JobRequirements:
Location: Netanya, Israel
 WHY YOU’LL LOVE CISCO We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. #We Are Cisco   WHAT YOU'LL DO We are looking for Software Engineer Intern to join the Digital Network Architecture Center (DNAC) product development team. In this role you will work on design and implementation of ground breaking new features and tackle critical customers issues in high scale enterprise production environments.   WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH Cisco is redefining the networking industry. To make this happen, we are heavily investing in team responsible for The Network. We are disrupting the industry by building a new networking platform that can learn, adapt, and secure itself at the speed of today’s businesses. Cisco Digital Network Architecture platform automates network management and provides our customers with state-of-the-art analytics and insights. You will work with one of the most hardworking group of engineers in the industry, bringing innovation into the networking world.   REQUIREMENTS -  Student graduating in 2022 pursuing a BA/BSc in Computer Science or Software Engineering from Technion, Tel Aviv, Ben-Gurion or Hebrew University with a GPA of 85 or above  -  Strong software development skills in Java/C#/C++  -  Good understanding of standard networking protocols  -  Software development experience in Linux environment  -  Very good verbal and written communication skills (English)   -  Hands on experience with scripting languages (Python, Perl)  -  You are curious to learn new technologies and collaborate with fellow engineers to raise the bar to create team success  
We understand from experience that not ticking every box on the skills sections stops many from applying. You should apply if you feel you are the right person for the job and have the aptitude to learn and deliver results.  
#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.   We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!  But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

What You'll Do

You'll be joining our Cisco Silicon One team which is the center of Cisco’s SW and ASIC design. Our engineers deal with all chip design aspects: definition, architecture, micro architecture, design, verification, signoff and validation.
We use the latest silicon technologies and processes to build largest scale and most complex devices at the edge of feasibility.

Who You'll Work With

You'll be part of our Group driving our game changing next generation network devices - Cisco Silicon One™. Our unique team works in a startup atmosphere inside a stable and leading corporate
Our design center is very unique -  hosting all silicon HW and SW development disciplines inside one site.
We are transforming the industry and building a new internet for the 5G era, providing a unified, programmable silicon architecture that is the foundation of all Cisco's future routing products.
Our devices are designed to be universally adaptable across service providers and web-scale markets, designed for fixed and modular platforms. Our devices deliver high speed without sacrificing programmability, buffering, power efficiency, scale or feature flexibility.
Cisco Silicon One™ is a revolutionary, ground-breaking technology for our customers and end users for decades to come! The Internet now has a new faster, better, safer engine!

 Learn more about us right here:
Silicon One Article
Cisco Silicon One movie
Cisco CEO talks to Fortune about 5G Chips
Israeli Calcalist on Leaba Cisco acquisition (in Hebrew)
Cisco Bets Its Business on 'Internet for the Future' Strategy

Who You Are

Excellent communication skills (in English)
Fast learner
B.Sc/M.Sc in Electrical Engineering from a Technion, Ben-Gurion, Tel-Aviv or Hebrew University with GPA above 85
It will be a big plus if you have experience in working on the DFT area from the definition via the design and up to full production


Why Cisco

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. 

We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. 

#WeAreCisco

Location: Netanya, Israel
What You'll Do  You will work on Cisco’s Next Gen traffic analytics technology Team which is responsible for detecting IOT devices, connected endpoints and network applications at real-time. As an intern you will be an integral part of the team growing to be a graduate engineer.  The technology we develop is used for Security solutions like network access control, IOT security, cybersecurity and bandwidth control systems all around Cisco networking portfolio and is at the bleeding edge Cisco software solutions.  You will build detection algorithms and tools for research of endpoints and IoT devices behavior in networks. You will investigate and reverse-engineer internet protocols as well as use data analytics to correlate and model information from thousands of sensors. You will understand and experiment with classification and anomaly detection techniques and get exposed to industry leading solutions in the security and application experience space.  We use Java and Python, running at high performance and scale and use a CI/CD development practices running on AWS. As part of the team you will make choices which impact the end product and customers' benefit, bringing innovative solutions to the field. You will have the opportunity to master existing skills while learning new ones and grow.  Who You'll Work With  You will work with one of the most talented group of engineers in the industry, bringing innovation into the networking world. We are part of the enterprise and security groups working on innovative technologies to detect and prevent cyber security attacks and allow control and segmentation policies. The team is executing in agile and lean methodology and uses cutting edge development and testing techniques. Every engineer is responsible for the complete life cycle of the code. We are working in a startup mode, backed up by giant Cisco.  Who You Are  
Student of Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Data Science from the Tel-Aviv, Technion or Hebrew University of Jerusalem with a GPA of at least 85. Being a student for the whole duration of the internship is a must (graduating in 2022-23).
A forward-thinking and independent individual with high level of curiosity and analytics skills.
Basic Knowledge with DBs and DB APIs - Mongo, SQL, REST
Basic knowledge in data processing - e.g. Jupyter, Pandas
Basic knowledge with Networks and Network analytics tools - Wireshark, NMAP
Passionate about Java, Python
Advantageous:
Related software development/Project or Cyber Security analysis & research
Networking background 
Experience with Java, Python programming
  Why Cisco  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it. We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. A blockchain company. An AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!
But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

The Team 

The Corporate Development (CD) organization is responsible for leading Cisco's external innovation strategy by driving acquisitions, as well as, venture investments through its corporate venture arm - Cisco Investments (www.ciscoinvestments.com). The team is comprised of over 40 professionals with deep market and technology expertise located in major geographies including the US, Israel, Europe, India, China and Singapore. Having invested in hundreds of companies and completed more than 220 acquisitions, the team has unparalleled experience and visibility across the technology industry. Cisco Investments currently manages an approximately $2B portfolio, with over 120 direct investments and more than 55 limited partner positions around the world.   
 The Opportunity 

As part of this high profile organization, Cisco is looking for an experienced executive to lead a team that manages Cisco's acquisition and investment activities in Israel. In addition to the currently identified market opportunities, the CD Israel team is expected to work with senior Cisco leadership to identify and develop the next set of geographic expansion strategies that have the potential to develop into new billion dollar businesses. Israel has been the most active geography for Cisco’s corporate development efforts outside the US. 
 Role & Responsibilities 

The individual will be responsible for driving all aspects of CD activities for this critical segment, including developing market strategies for growth and acting as the overall Israel lead for acquisitions, partnerships and venture capital investments – including sourcing, diligence, deal term structuring and post-deal monitoring. 
The individual will work closely with the executive leadership team at Cisco with visibility at the highest levels and have an active role in partnering with business units and functions and with senior regional Sales executives. 
This role provides an opportunity to be a major contributor to Cisco’s strategy for the future and the individual will have the ability to bring meaningful impact to Cisco. 
This role provides an opportunity to drive end to end acquisitions and investments and stay directly engaged with start up CEOs and company Boards. 
 Minimum Qualifications:
 The ideal candidate will have at least 15 years of experience across the technology industry, including significant strategy and transactional experience from a role in corporate development, venture capital, private equity or investment banking. 
Management experience will be required and the person must demonstrate the ability to be a leader both for his/her team as well as the broader CD organization. 
Potential candidates are expected to lead discussions with top executives both inside and outside of the company and be able to think outside of the box to drive creative thinking and decision making that has a high degree of strategic and financial impact. 
The person must be a self-starter with high EQ and demonstrate the ability to be successful in a global, unstructured, team-oriented environment. 

Relevant experience in the Enterprise software, hardware, IT, Telecommunications, datacenters or Cloud markets highly preferred. 
 Familiarity with a deal-oriented process and environment and ability to work under short timelines. 
Strong communication skills to work with senior executives across various business units and global theaters. 
Structured thinker with analytical and financial skills to work on complex financial transactions with minimal supervision. 
Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field such as Electrical Engineering or Computer Science from a leading university is highly preferred. 
 MBA from a top tier business school is highly preferred.

Cisco is the biggest networking company in the world! In our Massive Scale Infrastructure Group (MIG), we develop the future NMS\EMS products.

We are looking for the next outstanding engineer to join our amazing team.

6+ years of confirmed experience in Java.
Excellent Object Oriented design, Design Patterns and coding skills

Great teammate, proactive and productive, with strong background in computer science. Highly dedicated and motivated person.

Ability to ''dive'' into complex existing code

Oracle\SQL\PostgreSQL
Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.

You'll be joining our Cisco Silicon One team which is the center of Cisco’s ASIC design. 
Our engineers deal with all chip design aspects: from definition, architecture, coding to physical design and signoff.

We currently have three opportunities to offer. Here is what you can expect:

1.    Lab post silicon electrical characterization – very high-speed interfaces characterization and compliance to spec; silicon electrical validation including power, speed, process, and packaging thermal; high usage with lab high speed / RF equipment and automation.
2.    Signal integrity (SI) and Power integrity (PI): SI of very high-speed interfaces. Layout escape and routes geometries extractions, optimization and sign-off to the spec. Frequency and time domain analysis. PI of very power hungry and analog sensitive supplies, impedance profile extraction, time domain analysis of latest SI/PI tools and flows. Close relations with the IP/Packaging/PCB teams for max optimizations and tradeoffs.
3.    Package design from bump map and spec to full netlist and layout implementation. Large scale, multi die complex structures. Design signoff including high speed routes, LVS, LVL, IR drop etc’. Close relations with the IP/PD/PCB teams for max optimizations of the package design.
We use the latest silicon technologies and processes to build largest scale and most complex devices at the edge of feasibility.

Who You'll Work With
Top industry engineers in a fast-growing Silicon One group @ Cisco worldwide.
You'll be part of our Group driving our game changing next generation network devices - Cisco Silicon One™. Our unique team works in a startup atmosphere inside a stable and leading corporate.

Our design center is very unique - hosting all silicon HW and SW development disciplines inside one site.

We are transforming the industry and building a new internet for the 5G era, providing a unified, programmable silicon architecture that is the foundation of all Cisco's future routing products.

Our devices are designed to be universally adaptable across service providers and web-scale markets, designed for fixed and modular platforms. Our devices deliver high speed without sacrificing programmability, buffering, power efficiency, scale or feature flexibility.

Cisco Silicon One™ is a revolutionary, ground-breaking technology for our customers and end users for decades to come! The Internet now has a new faster, better, safer engine!

Who You Are
exceptional B.Sc Electrical Engineer student (graduating in 2022) from a TAU, Technion, Ben-Gurion or Hebrew University with average grades above 85
Practical engineer – advantage!
Experience in lab test/characterization, SI/PI analysis and board/package design is not a must.
You should have the passion for hands-on experience. You should be eager to learn and succeed!
Fluent English speaker
Able to work in Israel without additional visa support

What You'll Do

As a member of the SecureX UI team, you will:

Lead UX initiatives, gather requirements, wireframe, design in high fidelity, develop prototypes, deliver production quality assets, and ensure that implementations meet expectations
Possess the critical thinking skills, inventiveness, and work ethic required to design complex workflows, data-rich views and interactive visualizations
Design with the Cisco security portfolio in mind by building cross-team relationships, guiding integration UX efforts, digging into API documentation and performing other investigative tasks
Work with other product teams in Cisco's Security Business Group to standardize on UI elements and components for a uniform look and feel and shared capabilities across the portfolio
Design to the vision while being able to deliver piecemeal and iteratively for rapid release cycles

Who You’ll Work With

You will work closely with individuals and teams across and outside the organization (stakeholders, product managers, engineering, integrators, customers…) to represent both user and business interests in order to improve the product and portfolio experience. The SecureX UI team is looking for a candidate that is:
Self-motivated by the challenges put in front of them. We follow our stakeholder’s guidance but value autonomy and the inventiveness of designers that care about user needs and seek to improve the experience with ideas that present themselves along the way – outside of the documented roadmap
Able to take charge of the UX design process from start to finish, working across multiple disciplines to see designs from inception to use in production
Passionate about investigating new trends, techniques, and technologies and using them to keep products and processes innovative but not at the expense of being highly effective
Comfortable working with 2-week release cycle deadlines, longer-term milestones and the deliverables and diverse personalities associated with both

Who You Are

We’re looking for a team member that has:
A wide range of skills that spans interviewing stakeholders to stubbing out interaction patterns in prototyping tools or in code
Experience designing solutions representing large, complex data sets, enterprise type workflows, and interactive visualizations in an intuitive manner
Experience with integration-focused product ecosystems and the challenges involved (APIs, authorization models, context switching, etc.)
Mastery of Sketch, Invision, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, or other design software packages
Experience with HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and modern prototyping tools

We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a Lead Evangelist with a passion for cloud-native software to drive open source strategy to promote security and compliance best practices for the community. The successful candidate will serve as an influential technical ambassador to the Kubernetes community with the goal of gaining a following of end users who champion Kubernetes-native security and the Cisco KubeSec solution.

Who You'll Work With

The Emerging Technologies and Incubation (ET&I) team is a highly visible group which reports directly to Cisco’s CEO. ET&I focuses on the next wave of innovation by anticipating, investing in, and incubating new technologies and business ventures.
You will be part of the Incubation team, to develop new solutions, and bring them to market in a startup like environment.

Responsibilities
- Lead technical marketing content plans and execution including development of  high-impact messaging, content in various forms such as technical demos, technology blog posts, industry thought leadership articles, podcasts, or others
- Drive open source efforts in collaboration with R&D leaders
- Establish recognition within the Kubernetes community as a top expert on Kubernetes security
- Provide influential thought leadership to Kubernetes end users that shape their approach to topics that include, but are not limited to, security, operations, and management
- Engage with key stakeholders within the community including the CNCF Governing Board and Technical Oversight Committee (TOC) as well as leaders of Special Interest Groups (SIGs) to influence key community decisions
- Speak at Tier 1 industry events such as KubeCon
- Act as a subject matter expert on key trends and technologies that are shaping the direction of the cloud-native ecosystem  

Who You Are

- 8+ years of experience, including 3+ years of experience in developer advocacy or evangelism, software engineering, or equivalent
- Substantial hands-on experience with container technologies (e.g., Kubernetes, Docker)
- Knowledge of DevOps methodologies, tooling and/or cloud platforms (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure)
- Interest in DevSecOps, security engineering and methodologies
- Demonstrated track record of open source contributions, community engagement, public speaking, and authored content
- Well-recognized profile within the Kubernetes community and CNCF ecosystem
- Previous experience leading or participating in open source decision making
- Successful track record in influencing adoption of new technologies and/or products
- Knowledge of security engineering, architectures and/or tooling

JobRequirements:
What You'll Do

You'll develop Core Software technologies at the heart of tomorrow's leading infrastructure solutions, tackling the entire range of challenges from user-facing API-s, through high-level algorithms, all the way down to firmware.

The Cisco Silicon One team develops breakthrough next-generation silicon products.
If you're looking to work with amazing people, developing the first iteration of world-class products, join us!

In this role, you will:
• Design and develop software driving the world's most complex infrastructures
• Gain intimate knowledge of world-class silicon and programming models
• Work with architecture and design teams to define the next generation of ASIC products being developed

Who You'll Work With

You'll be joining Cisco Silicon One team which is the center of Cisco’s SW and ASIC design.
You'll be part of our group driving our game changing next generation network devices - Cisco Silicon One™. Our unique team works in a startup atmosphere inside a stable and leading corporate.
Our R&D center is very unique -  hosting all silicon HW and SW development disciplines inside one site.
We are transforming the industry and building a new internet for the 5G era, providing a unified, programmable silicon architecture that is the foundation of all Cisco's future routing products.
Our devices are designed to be universally adaptable across service providers and web-scale markets, designed for fixed and modular platforms. Our devices deliver high speed without sacrificing programmability, buffering, power efficiency, scale or feature flexibility.
Cisco Silicon One™ is a revolutionary, ground-breaking technology for our customers and end users for decades to come! The Internet now has a new faster, better, safer engine!

Our team develops the full software stack enabling the Leaba ASIC. Join a team of talented engineers with a proven track-record at delivering breakthrough products.

You have a unique opportunity to join this team at an early stage and work with us to design and deliver breakthrough technologies.

Who You Are

"Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life."
Work is amazing when you work with amazing people.
If you:
• Have a cheerful, positive attitude
• Are a brilliant software/electrical engineer, regardless of previous experience
• Can quickly ramp on multiple, interdisciplinary domains
• Love tackling complex problems
• Have a B.Sc or higher, Cum Laude (GPA 85+) from the Technion, TAU, HUJI or BGU, or are highly recommended by a Cisco employee.
Now's the time to contact us!

Why Cisco

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.

We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.

#WeAreCisco #BeYouWithUs

Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all. 

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! 


#LI-MZ1

Who You'll Work With
Customer Experience (CX) Customer Success Specialists (CSS) are a team of extraordinary technical guides whose #1 focus is to deliver exclusive customer experience. We help solve business challenges with network-centric solutions that accelerate customer and partner success and dedication. Our success is measured through customer happiness metrics, industry recognition, and employee happiness scores.
As a team we know that in engineering and customer success, you can only be successful together, so we emphasize a culture of helping each other, working together, winning together and having fun together. As a CSS team we help customers adopt and expand Cisco solutions by showing impact on the customer’s business goals. Maintaining an end-to-end lens, as CSSs we partner closely with Customer Success Executives, Success Programs Managers, sales accounts teams, delivery teams, partners and others.
What You‘ll Do
As the CSS you are a guide to the client on your aligned product or architecture. Your mission is to help the customer move to the next phase of the customer lifecycle and to visualize their future in the lifecycle. You will:
Deliver workshops and webinars (Accelerators and ATX - Ask-the-Expert) to a diverse set of customers that qualify, tailoring deliverables and driving business outcomes within scope and on-time engagement
Join the Customer Success team in customer engagements and events to improve customer adoption and address product concerns
Contribute to the customer community digital spaces and asset development of Success Tracks
Contribute to product and offer improvement by providing lifecycle feedback to CX Product Management and CX Success Programs Teams
Inspire customers to make tactical and strategic deployment decisions and track long term business outcomes
Collaborate with Account teams, Customer Success, and Partners to elevate customer adoption as well as address product concerns
Drive adoption and expansion of Cisco products by highlighting feature opportunities, winning use cases, and relevant strategies to customers and the Success team
Contribute to lifecycle asset development and maintenance through rotations, asset development sprints, and/or stretch assignments with the Lifecycle Success team
Who You Are
You are a technical expert across multiple technology specializations and you have hands on extensive technical expertise. You have industry recognized certifications and an ability to drive change through innovation. You are a proven leader driving team activities/task.
Customer Obsessed: You love customer interactions and understand customer needs and align architectural and vertical expertise to multi-functional teams
Technical Guide: You are able to explain technical concepts, give clients guidance and vision about the solution. You have a thorough understanding of the technical fundamentals of aligned technology/specialization areas, including features and use cases. Suggested Certifications: CCNA / CCNP / CCDP/ CCIE, Cisco Certified Success Specialist, CISM, CISSP.
Business Aware: You can connect technology solutions to business outcomes
Effective Communicator: You articulate the technical features into business impact, you can easily talk about technology to non-technical people. You are also an active listener. Fluency in French, German, Spanish, Italian and/or Russian is a plus.

What You'll Do

The Business Entity
The Cisco Security Business Group (SBG) develops best-in-class content and network security products and leads the market in firewall, intrusion prevention, remote access, and content security technologies. Cisco Umbrella Cloud Security  is a secure internet gateway that provides the first line of defense against threats on the internet wherever users go. Because it's built into the foundation of the internet, Umbrella delivers complete transparency into internet activity across all locations, devices, and users.

Who You'll Work With

We're a group of engineers, technologists, designers building products that are simple to use and easy to manage. Working at Cisco on the Umbrella team means being surrounded by passionate, intelligent and creative people who are determined to disrupt the security industry with endless innovation, premier research, and outstanding products and services.

Who You Are

As a Product Manager, you enjoy thinking through what it takes to build a world-class product, you know how to communicate that to engineering, how to see it through a successful launch, communicate it to sales and generate market impact and customer adoption. You love technology, and you love the business side of it even more. You may have been an engineer before, but the engineering you do now is in business: you passionately engineer your business and your product’s growth. In this position, you will help run the cloud security business by driving the right features in the product you own, tackle interesting business projects arising from customer, channel and platform opportunities and challenges. It will be your responsibility as a PM that we agree on the right strategy for the role your product plays in the portfolio, as well as that we execute plans for your product so that it delivers on the strategy. Are you looking for the next challenge to sink your teeth into? We’d love to hear from you.

 What You'll Do
Become an authority in your space. Our Product Managers work directly with customers to understand the space your product is in, personas using it and buying it, and ecosystem in which it operates.
Conduct market analysis, competitive analysis and translate it to product direction. Identify and present innovative and creative product and business solutions that help your business and deliver on our strategy.
Validate requirements and resulting product features with customers to ensure success.
Broker and facilitate product decisions cross-functionally.
Be able to balance business and user needs with technical constraints - discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative approaches, and lead and encourage engineering efforts to meet targets.
Work with the broader Product Management team to craft effective GTM strategies, work cross-functionally to have them implemented. Partner with sales and SE teams for effective introduction of product into the market.
Maintain solid understanding of relevant technologies, contribute as a thought leader in the security industry.
Produce case studies, white papers, presentations, and other materials to help evangelize the product.
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum of 5+ years Product Management experience (MBA preferred)
Domain expertise in cloud-delivered security services

 Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

JobTitle: R&D Product Owner - Endpoint Privilege Manager
JobRequirements:
About CyberArk:                                                                                                      
CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), the global leader in Identity Security, Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity – human or machine – across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world’s leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. 
  Job Description:
CyberArk is looking for an experienced Product Owner (PO) for an Endpoint Privilege Manager service.
CyberArk’s Product Owner (PO), a member of R&D development team responsible for filling the gap between the market requirements as presented by Product Management 
and the solution that determines how to implement these requirements in our products.
Using comprehensive business and technical knowledge, the PO accompanies the entire development process starting from the requirements definitions, planning phase,
through the development and testing process to successful deployment to our Service.
The PO works closely with the Development Team, Product Management, Professional Services and Technical Writers.
  Candidate Qualities
• You are highly motivated by the outcomes your products help create. Seeing customers delighted and succeeding with your products is a great professional pleasure for you.
• You are passionate about creating complete, finished products. A rock-solid "Definition of Done" is one of your most trusted tools.
• You thrive when an engineering team is in sync with your vision for how a product experience should materialize. Driving alignment across an engineering team is something you do naturally.
• You work in an agile manner, in all that you do. Pivoting based on new information is something you understand as an inevitability, not something to resist
  Responsibilities:
• Produce valuable content for our customers
• Own the product backlog - Deconstruct large features to smaller pieces, define and prioritize the pieces that can compose a releasable product
• Be the central focal point for all parties outside of R&D department for; how the product works, what the product can do, and how a certain change will affect the product
• Analyze product business requirements and produce a functional design
• Utilize deep knowledge of the product and its use by customers to work hand-in-hand with rest of R&D, explain the requirements and answer any functional questions
  Requirements:
• Innovator by nature. Thinking out of the box.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills
• At least 8 years of experience in the software industry
• 2-3 years of experience as functional analyst/product owner/business analyst/product management, in the software industry. Experience in writing functional designs.
• Proven technical skills and self-learning ability, capable of thoroughly understanding the functional and technical aspects of a complex system
• Proactive, highly motivated individual with a serious work ethic and goal-oriented approach
• BSc in computer-science/engineering, or 3-5 years hands-on experience in software development
• Proven Agile experience 
• Proven management skills 
• SaaS and Endpoint Security experience – an advantage
  To learn more about CyberArk, visit https://www.cyberark.com, read the CyberArk blogs or follow on Twitter via @CyberArk, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job ID: R072135

Cybersecurity Senior Principal Engineer
London / Remote / United Kingdom / EMEA
Dell Technologies' commitment to serving our customers is second only to our desire to protect our customers. This strategic role will bring cybersecurity expertise to focus on the risks that impact our global customer base. Working with a team of Incident Responders and Threat Intel analysts, you shall be responsible for not only remediating high severity security incidents, but also play a key role in contributing towards initiatives like Threat Hunting, Digital Forensics and Threat Intelligence. You get to do all this while enjoying the company of team members in a culture where new ideas and calculated risks are strongly encouraged and appreciated.

What you’ll achieve
The Cybersecurity Senior Principal Engineer must be a strong leader in the security field with proven technical skills and experience in researching, validating and responding to advanced threat actors. The ideal candidate will be a Subject Matter Expert in Cybersecurity Threat Detection and Analysis, Incident Response and Digital Forensics. In this role, the candidate will leverage all available data sources, security tools and threat trends and, combining security monitoring and analysis techniques, will identify attacks against the organizations. Such efforts are intended to determine the source of the threat, the extent to which client assets have been compromised, recommendations for, and assistance with remediation.

You will:
Conduct advanced technical investigations for critical incidents paying attention to specific analysis and fast remediation advice with a focus on improving the customer security posture.  Effectively manage and remediate any Incident irrespective of the environment (Corp or Cloud)
Conduct Forensic analysis of infected hosts or analyze network traffic to identify attacker activity.  Handle specific forensic and malware analysis, as well as complex log analysis requests.
Perform event correlation review through incoming data feeds, ticketing systems and security alert mechanisms.  Provide context on complex security incidents from Customer and other available resources, collect and assemble data, as well as contribute to technical reports
Utilize in-depth technical knowledge to design procedures for the detection of threat actor’s behaviour, as well as develop and implement standard technical procedures (runbooks) to be used by the Security Monitoring team for day to day operations.  Make recommendations for remediation and process improvements and for applying MITRE ATT&CK and NIST framework aligned strategies to the Customer’s environment
Mentor and train members of the Detection and Monitoring team on how to conduct Incident Response effectively

Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:

Essential Requirements
Multiple security certifications such as:
- SANS GCIA, GCIH, CCNA, CCIE, NGFW Specialization, GREM, GCFE, OSCP (Threat Hunting specialist)
Typically requires 10+ years of related experience in a professional role ; Solid knowledge of Incident Response, Traffic and Malware Analysis, Forensics, and analysis of security and infrastructure logs
Understanding of SIEM, IDS/IPS, Web Gateway, DLP, Firewall, Vulnerability Management, Endpoint Security solutions, Linux and Windows operating systems, Cloud, Web/Email services, Honeypots, Sinkholes and Malware Sandbox Technologies
Understanding of threat intelligence and threat modelling concepts Experience in conducting network traffic analysis and the detection of malicious code on endpoint systems
Understanding of vulnerability and exploit analysis; Advanced knowledge of cybersecurity components, principles, practices, and procedures Leverage big data analysis to provide customer environment insight; Understanding of computer network exploitation (CNE) and computer network defense (CND) concepts; Ability to research about targeted threat groups and their tactics, techniques and procedures (TTP)
Desirable Requirements
Previous experience delivering end-to-end cybersecurity incident response solutions
Working knowledge of EDR & NGAV products such as Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Sentinel, Carbon Black, McAfee, Crowdstrike, SentinelOne etc Working knowledge of EDR & NGAV products such as Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Sentinel, Carbon Black, McAfee, Crowdstrike, SentinelOne etc
Scripting & Query expertise such as PowerShell, Python, KQL, SQL etc.

Job ID: R080531

JobTitle: Intern - VMware Research Group - Resource Efficient Federated Learning - Opportunity for Working Remotely
JobRequirements:
Business Summary
Come be part of VMware’s Research Group (VRG)! With a dedicated research group, VMware continues its long tradition of research focus and academic reach. We continue VMware's history of ground-breaking, technological innovation and a culture of technical leadership and market disruption. We aim to build a community of deep and substantial relationships between academic research and the rest of the company and to maintain deep interaction and collaboration by recruiting premier researchers who are keen on driving impact.
JobRoleandResponsibilities
We seek students who are passionate about machine learning, systems and solving challenging real-world problems.  In this position, you’ll conduct research on improving the system and machine learning performance of well-known machine learning models, such as federated and distributed ML, and neural networks. 
Machine Learning systems require guarantees to adhere to necessary resource efficiency constraints.  For instance, federated learning requires low bandwidth; anomaly detection over edge devices requires fast classification and low memory footprint; cloud systems require fast training to reduce costs.
In this project, we are looking into efficiency from compute and network perspectives.
Compute:
The increase in available information and complexity of ML models results in excessive compute resource consumption. 
It is therefore of major importance to re-examine and better understand the trade-offs of an ML system from compute-efficiency perspective.
Network:
Distributed and federated learning systems are key enablers of global, scalable and fair learning procedures.
However, these systems require significant network resources that threaten the feasibility of the solutions.
Therefore, acquiring a better understanding of the inherent ML performance and network efficiency tradeoffs of different distributed and federated learning systems is of major importance. 
Such understanding can help to reason about better architectures and algorithms for distributed and federated learning.
More information on the body of work this project belongs to can be found here:
https://research.vmware.com/projects/trustworthy-machine-learning
Required Skills:
Pursing a PhD degree in Computer Science or other related concentration.
You have extensive knowledge of machine learning and systems.
Ability to work independently.
Ability to generate new ideas and innovate in an academic research setting.
Strong teamwork and communication skills.
Peer-reviewed research publication(s) at top conferences.
Experience in Python is a plus (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch).
Preferred Skills
Prior experience working with Tensorflow Federated (TFF)
Willingness to contribute to open-source projects is a plus.
Previous industry experience is a plus.

Subcategory: Internships
Experience: Internship
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time

Senior Data Scientist
Data Science is all about breaking new ground to enable businesses to answer their most urgent questions. Pioneering massively parallel data-intensive analytic processing, our mission is to develop a whole new approach to generating meaning and value from petabyte-scale data sets and shape brand new methodologies, tools, statistical methods and models. What’s more, we are in collaboration with leading academics, industry experts and highly skilled engineers to equip our customers to generate sophisticated new insights from the biggest of big data.
Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Senior Data Scientist on our Data Science team in Beer Sheba.

What you’ll achieve
Our team develops new methodologies, capabilities and tools to enable advanced modeling and statistical analysis of business data and very often, very large business data. Our Data Science team works with prospects and internal customers to prove the analytical capabilities of Dell’s technology in generating business insights from big data.
A member of our Data Science team is charged with understanding and prioritizing our business and customers’ most urgent data driven problems and opportunities and use advanced mathematical methods and models to provide answers.

You will:
Work, under little to no supervision on tight schedule projects, with internal and external teams to understand customer requirements and develop proposals and data-driven, AI solutions to address to those requirements
Perform end-to-end steps involved in solution development, while establishing subject-matter expertise in key horizontal or vertical themes. Steps include preliminary data exploration and data preparation steps, variable/algorithm selection, model development/validation and scoring. Horizontal themes include: Marketing Analytics, Operations Research, Text Analytics, Graph Analytics, Hadoop, etc. Vertical themes include: Financial Services, Retail/CPG, Energy, Life Sciences, etc.
Independently develop and drive the model development lifecycle, testing of algorithms' efficacy (i.e., by applying to test/sampled data and assessing accuracy/fit/predictive strength) for differing analytical use-cases
Develop and apply a broad range of techniques and theories from statistics, machine learning, and business intelligence to deliver actionable business insights to prospects and customers based on large-scale data
Communicate and explain results and insights to business executives throughout projects’ life cycle
Join in defining of project use-cases, scope definition, and ongoing interaction with customers and business partners to provide status updates and shares analytical insights

Experience with the data science toolbox, i.e:
Programming and Scripting skills (C, C++, C#, Java, Python, Bash, etc)
Big Data technologies (Apache Spark, GreenPlum DB, Hadoop, Cassandra, MongoDB, etc)

'PowerFlexs' (aka ScaleIO) is a highly distributed and parallel software defined storage system that utilize cutting-edge homegrown IP to approach problems traditionally approachable only via designated hardware.

We are looking for great team players to join our family and take part of a complex SW development & testing through agile software lifecycle.

4. Senior Front-End Developer (Haifa and Glil-Yam)
If you love algorithms, dream of advanced data-structures, savor eureka moments and want to work with insanely talented people - 'PowerFlex' is your next home and away-from-home

Job ID: R087085

RSA helps the world's leading organizations solve their most complex and sensitive security challenges. These challenges include managing organizational risk, safeguarding mobile access and collaboration, proving compliance, and securing enterprise and cloud environments against today’s most sophisticated threats. Combining business-critical solutions in identity & authentication management, network forensics and GRC capabilities, RSA provides visibility and analytics to safeguard the identities and information of organizations worldwide.   
Be a part of RSA Anti-Fraud Business Unit (BU)’s internal cyber security team to help design, build and manage RSA’s corporate & Software as a Service (SaaS) security infrastructure and services. This is an exciting opportunity to reimagine our corporate infrastructure utilizing industry leading technologies and collaborate with our digital transformation office teams as part of RSA’s transition into a standalone security company. The greater Security Architecture & Engineering team is accountable for providing security architecture, security consulting, security engineering and product security governance to the business. We are seeking individuals who share our values, thrive in a team environment, and recognize the importance of accountability; people who strive to exceed expectations to ensure our success. With team members located globally, you will have an excellent opportunity to influence the security culture at RSA and further develop your career.     
Key Responsibilities
Provide Architecture, Strategy and Consulting regarding cybersecurity capabilities for both on premise and SaaS security environments areas such as next generation firewall, web proxy, vpn, firewall as a service, antivirus, endpoint detection & response, vulnerability management, multifactor authentication, identity & access management solutions, centralized log management/SIEM platforms, and secure cloud implementations 
Be the subject matter expert on the technical solution implementation details for security capabilities across the business unit
Accountable for Security Architecture strategy, security capability maturity roadmaps, oversight of effectiveness and operational execution
Create technical standards, guidelines and documented reference architectures for engineering and IT reference
Build cloud security strategy, supporting documentation and overall maturity plan for the BU
Provide cybersecurity consulting support for project design reviews, technical remediations, third party technical risk reviews and emerging security threats
Provide technical control implementation expertise against security compliance frameworks such as PCI-DSS, PCI-3DS, ISO 27001/2, NIST 800-53
Work cross-functionally with other leads in security, IT or business functions to meet project milestones and service levels
Drive corporate programs and ensures deadlines are met while also ensuring that security goals and initiatives are successfully implemented
Communicates and translates RSA Anti-Fraud technical security vision/strategy to organization
Creates a collaborative environment across IT, Engineering and business functions to achieve defined business security outcomes
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior members of the cybersecurity team
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Information Security or related major; or equivalent job experience
6+ years direct Security Architecture or Senior Security Engineering in a progressive technology setting, utilizing both MS Azure and AWS cloud service providers
12+ years technical Security subject matter expertise in multiple area such as Network Security, Endpoint Security, Identity & Access Management, Secure Software Development Practices, Cloud Security, Encryption
Strong security expertise in various Cloud Service Providers such as AWS, Azure, GCP with demonstrable examples of security architecture frameworks, standards and secure process
Strong expertise in secure software development lifecycle (SSDLC) and DevSecOps practices
Experience with leveraging automation strategies via infrastructure or configuration as code practices
Ability to lead, influence, motivate and direct a workgroup to achieve results
Excellent communication skills
Ability to prioritize projects and/or deliverables

Senior Data Scientist
Beer Sheva, Israel
Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Senior Data Scientist on our Data Science team in Beer Sheva site.
Dell is committed to the development of data-driven and high business value machine learning and artificial intelligence use cases and solutions. We are looking for talented individuals to join our data science team, which is developing a fundamentally new approach to how business generates meaning from data.
Our team develops new methodologies, capabilities and tools to enable advanced modeling and statistical analysis of business data and very often, very large business data. Our Data science team works with prospects and internal customers to prove the analytical capabilities of Dell’s technology in generating business insights from big data.
A member of our Data Science team is charged with understanding and prioritizing our business and customers’ most urgent data driven problems and opportunities and use advanced mathematical methods and models to provide answers.
Our Data Scientists develop new practices and methodologies for working with the Dell data warehouse technology, working closely with leading academics and industry experts – often as part of pilot projects. Team members also work with engineers to create new tools and features that support sophisticated machine learning and data science capabilities.
Key responsibilities
Work, under little to no supervision on tight schedule projects, with internal and external teams to understand customer requirements and develop proposals and data-driven, AI solutions to address to those requirements
Lead and perform end-to-end steps involved in solution development, while establishing subject-matter expertise in key horizontal or vertical themes. Steps include preliminary data exploration and data preparation steps, variable/algorithm selection, model development/validation and scoring. Horizontal themes include: Marketing Analytics, Operations Research, Text Analytics, Graph Analytics, Hadoop, etc. Vertical themes include: Financial Services, Retail/CPG, Energy, Life Sciences, etc.
Independently develop and drive the model development lifecycle, testing of algorithms' efficacy (i.e., by applying to test/sampled data and assessing accuracy/fit/predictive strength) for differing analytical use-cases

Job ID: R090544

Cloud Software Senior Engineer

Competitive salary

Be’er Shiva, Israel


Dell provides the technology that transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We inspire, challenge and respect every one of our over 100,000 employees. We also provide them with unparalleled growth and development opportunities. We can’t wait for you to discover this for yourself as a Senior Software Senior Engineer on our Dell Cloud team in Be’er Shiva, Israel. 

The Software Engineering team delivers next-generation software application enhancements and new products for a changing world. Working at the cutting edge, we design and develop software for platforms, peripherals, applications and diagnostics — all with the most advanced technologies, tools, software engineering methodologies and the collaboration of internal and external partners. 

Key Responsibilities 
Be a technical leader on an Agile team, collaboratively realizing features through the software development lifecycle
Lead in design, development and unit testing of the Dell Cloud products including enhancements and/or resolution of any issues that may be reported
Design, code, test, debug and document software according to Dell Cloud’s systems standards, policies and procedures, and navigate between these responsibilities
Responsible for preparing design documentation
Prepare flow charts and systems diagrams to assist in problem analysis
Essential Requirements
8+ years of related experience in a professional role with a Bachelor’s degree, OR 4+ years with a Master’s degree
Expertise in Microservices architecture and developing Java microservices for cloud
Proficient in Java, Spring framework, Spring boot, Spring batch with a good knowledge of its ecosystems, solid understanding of object-oriented programming
Experience in architecting and implementing highly scalable, high throughput web applications and backend systems
Exposure to mature development processes including use of source code control systems like Git

Desirable Requirements 
Familiarity with highly scalable, high throughput web applications and backend systems
Good knowledge of Build and Release, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles

Benefits
We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment. 

If you’re ready to develop cutting-edge software for a changing world, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell.

Job ID: R089935

Product Management Senior Advisor
Showcasing excellence and innovation at every stage, Product Management is responsible for the cross-functional management of products or solutions through their entire lifecycle. Using a wealth of technical and industry experience, we work across functional areas to implement our products or solutions. We undertake thorough analysis of the markets to ensure we maximize profitability and adjust our product strategies to respond to competition. Our role also involves acting as subject matter experts for internal and external product events or partner meetings.
Join us as a Senior Advisor on our Product Management team in Israel to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

What you’ll achieve
As a Product Management Senior Advisor, you will identify new growth areas, technologies and emerging product/service opportunities. You will conduct in-depth market analysis to optimize existing products/solutions and build next generation products, partnering closely with the Engineering and Product Management teams to build a product road map and align product strategies for the business.
You will:
• Manage products throughout their entire lifecycle
• Support business case for improvements or new products
• Capture and manage requirements and provide a simple interpretation
• Drive preparation for external and internal product events

• Excellent technology/engineering skills relating to design, test and quality
• Solid grasp of business goals and objectives as they relate to customer use cases and solutions
• Excellence in understanding competitors and their products as well as potential partner relationships for the product

Desirable Requirements
• Proven experience working on a world-class product
• 8 to 12 years of relevant experience

Senior Analyst, Channel Marketing
Channel Marketing is, quite simply, at the heart of the global success of Dell Technologies. It’s a huge and far-reaching area – planning, developing and implementing programs for distributors, resellers, international promotions and marketing. Our expertise is integral to enhancing Dell’s presence at partner’s point of sales and increasing the rate of recommendation to customers. We’re also at the heart of customer and market insight, supporting Sales and Merchandising teams with recommendations about the latest trends and how best to reach the customer. And that’s not all – we’re instrumental in everything from sales forecasting to return on investment analysis.
Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Senior Analyst on our Marketing team in Israel.

You will make a significant contribution to achieving our CEE business goals through Support Marketing team to develop, implement and execute programs that align with Sales Strategy. Strong and close cooperation with partners will be your key responsibility during daily work.

Edge Security Product Manager
Join us as a Security Product Manager on our Edge Strategy team in Israel to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact. The Edge Strategy team is a newly formed global team in Dell Technologies, aimed to enhance and grow Dell’s success at the evolving edge market.
What you’ll achieve
As the edge security product manager, you will lead the end to end security conceptualization and definition of our new edge initiative. You will work with internal ISG BU’s teams to understand the unique challenges and constraints of the edge and define the right security strategy and solutions to ensure our offerings are secure. You will do the solution exploration and design and guide a dedicated global team of super talented engineers to build the ultimate end to end Dell edge solutions.

Learn the security challenges at the edge, analyze our evolving solutions and identify key areas to ensure they are secure.
Work closely with engineering teams across Dell and its partners to define requirements and testing procedures to ensure our solutions meet the required security standards and exceed customers’ expectations.

Engage with customers and partners and drive security-related conversations towards successful business engagements.

Job ID: R091917

Senior HR Generalist
Business change, leadership succession planning, effective team member relations – all are key issues in a forward-thinking business such as Dell Technologies. Our HR Generalists are at the heart of it all, playing an integral role in the organization. We lead the planning and implementation of high-value, quality human resources programs, practices and procedures for people at all levels. We’re also trusted to advise company leaders on HR policy and programs, recommending decisions in line with the company’s strategic direction.
Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a HR Generalist on our TMSD (Team Members Service Desk) team in Israel /EMEA. We are working in remote mode and after you can come to the office 1-2 a week.

What you’ll achieve
The core responsibility of a TMSD (Team Members Service Desk) Advisor is to provide front line support of HR programs, processes, and policies to team members across the organization by providing quality real-time solutions to team member and leader enquiries and requests .The TMSD Advisor is required to work closely with and partner with the Regional HR Teams and other centers of excellence to properly understand the various programs, policies and procedures and to drive continuous process improvements to enhance customer experience and minimize labor risk in the countries that they support.

You will:
Provide front-line support for all cases that fall within the scope of TMSD (cases may be raised through self-service, telephone, email, walk-up or chat as is available for the location supported).
Collaborate with Regional HR and other centers of excellence to ensure that all customers have a ‘One HR’ experience in resolution of their cases.
Utilize best practice, consult the relevant knowledge bases/subject matter experts to timeously and effectively resolve all cases
Lead or participate in local, regional, global projects.
