We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group. Our mission is to develop products and technologies that empower any person in the world to thrive online. We bring extraordinary client-facing solutions to more than 190M people and businesses - and their customers - in over 20 different product lines. These include ecommerce, website builders, blog, booking platforms, media, customer development solutions and more.
As an industry leading engineering group, we’re pushing the boundaries of web development to its limits. We build complex micro-frontends with extremely scalable and resilient architectures, which combine into stunning applications running in our customers’ browsers.
Our engineering culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD and clean code. We work in small teams, follow agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly. Our goal is to maintain the highest standards of development, while having fun doing so. And, we love sharing knowledge and contributing back to the open source community.
You are:
An exceptional frontend developer with at least 5 years’ experience working on client-side development on large scales. You’re an expert on the latest JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Vue, etc), tools (Babel, Webpack/Rollup/Parcel) and languages (Typescript, ES6+).
You always love to learn more, are able to work independently and you love sharing knowledge and best practices. Got experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Delivery? That’s a bonus!
As a Senior Frontend Developer, you will:
Work on cutting-edge technologies that make a powerful impact on over 190 million users.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Write (a lot) of high-quality, functional Javascript. Additionally, you’ll work with Git, Node.js, React, Redux, MobX and ES6+.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Invest your time in personal growth, as part of the FED Guild at Wix.
Manage and complete tasks using TDD, continuous integration and modern development processes.

JobTitle: Frontend Engineer - Stylable Open Source Project
JobRequirements:
We are:
The innovation team of Wix that creates new and cutting-edge solutions for the web. Our current projects include Stylable, a CSS preprocessor enabling developers to write reusable, highly-performant components by extending CSS with a type system.
We’re looking for a full-stack developer to join our innovative team. We love passionate people who are masters of front and back-end technologies, with strong connections to the open-source community.
You are:
A strong developer with 3 years experience and a passion for open source projects. You are an expert at compilation and bundling optimization. You understand how to program IDE language support.
As a Software Developer, you will:
Work on improving our current open source solutions, such as Stylable.
Get involved in the community of users to understand and prioritize future development.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Write tested and clean code.

We are:
Wix Wow! - a team within Wix’s Editor group, dedicated to creating innovative tools and amazing experiences for Wix’s 200 million users. We specialize mostly in graphics and motion, and use every possible technology at our disposal, both in the browser, and beyond. We seek out creative trends in web design and creation, and bring it into the Wix Platform and Editors in the most intuitive way. We value pixels, colors, slick performance and smooth motion. We dabble in videos, images, SVG, CSS, WebGL, and everything else the web has to offer.
You are:
A Frontend Developer, with an orientation for pixels and motion. You know your CSS, and SVG and Canvas are your friends. You know your way around the APIs a browser natively offers, and can write fluent vanilla JavaScript. You can spot frame drops, layouts and color differences, and you’re passionate about creating tools and experiences.
You’re a self learner, and are very motivated to solve problems, both in a team and independently. Creating stuff for the web is your profession, not (just) your job.
As a Frontend Developer for Wix Wow!, you will:
Create jaw-dropping components and effects for the Wix Platform.
Create Editor(s) tools and experiences to create those effects.
Maintain and enhance current products and features created by the team.
Integrate these with other Wix products.
Work in a highly experienced and exclusive team of professionals.
Be free to go wild with creativity.

We are:
The Editor Team at Wix. We serve at the core of the company’s offering - responsible for the code that runs millions of websites built with Wix platform. We ensure the UI makes Wix sites easy to create and maintain. The Editor engineering teams pave the way for innovation in web technologies, working closely with React, Typescript and ES6. Additionally, the team balances between building a product with massive-scale architecture, while guaranteeing its development is quick and fun.
You are:
Passionate about software engineering. You don’t just build websites, you want to be at the center of frontend and full stack development. You’re experienced in frontend/full stack development (preferred), or other high-abstraction technologies such as Java, mobile apps and platforms. You’re also well-versed in computer science fundamentals–copying and pasting CSS snippets from stack-overflows bore you. You want to solve real, software engineering problems.
As a Frontend Engineer, you will:
Manage and complete tasks through TDD, continuous integration and modern development processes.
Write (a lot) of high-quality, functional Javascript. Additionally, you’ll work with Git, Node.js, React, Redux, MobX, ES6 and SASS.
Handle fixes and develop new features for our website viewer platform and Editor UI.
Participate in designing APIs, mechanisms and abstractions for the Wix Editor platform.
Push your limits and challenge your understanding of how to scale frontend development.
Make a powerful and positive impact on over 100 million users.
Have a lot of fun. The Editor Team is AWESOME!

We are:
Wix Engineering’s Frontend management team - we enable the continuous growth of our group while preserving our professional standards, development velocity, cross team communication and developer community feeling on a large scale. The frontend engineering group (aka FED Guild) is made up of 100s of developers working in dozens of teams and growing rapidly. At this kind of volume, we need to be active in solving the question of how we do things at high scale and as we grow the questions keep changing, for example:
How can we define the professional standards we believe in ensure that they are maintained throughout all teams?
How do we foster a culture of sharing knowledge and collaboration and maintain the community feeling in a large organization and not fall into working in silos?
How do we keep recruiting the strongest developers in the industry, onboard dozens of new engineers each year and build for the future by training junior developers and interns?
The Frontend management team sits in Wix’s main offices in Israel, Ukraine & Lithuania. Each manager is responsible for the local efforts in their office and collaborates with the rest of the team on global efforts. Together, we work on managing recruitment, building and maintaining the crash course every developer in Wix goes through, building junior/interns training programs, leading internal community events such as webinars, workshops and temporary swaps between teams which give people wider context. In addition, we lead a cross-Wix forum of developers where each group has at least one representative (aka FED Guild Masters forum), working on defining our standards and maintaining them all over Wix.
You are:
An experienced engineering manager of large teams who comes from a frontend, hands-on architecture background. You’re able to communicate at the highest levels both with group managers and frontend architects. You’re super proactive and innovative, able to think outside the box, recognize the most important problem to solve and relentlessly go at it.
You’re a true visionary, able to lead large groups of developers, set the tone, plan long term strategy and execute towards it. You deal well with the challenges of matrix management, and you’re capable of pleasantly managing the conflicts that arise and find win-win solutions. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in your own language, as well as in English.
As FED Guild Manager, you will:
Lead the frontend engineering group (aka FED Guild) in the Israel offices (Tel Aviv, Be’er Sheva & Haifa).
Define the vision for the FED Guild in Israel, working together with managers and architects to make it happen.
Collaborate with FED Guild Managers from Ukraine and Lithuania on global efforts and vision.
Have a wide understanding of Wix’s roadmap, finding the cross-Wix FED Guild focus in order to promote it.
Manage the forum of developer representatives from all teams (aka FED Guild Masters forum) working together on defining our professional standards and implementing them in their teams.
Maintain close one-on-one relationships with the Guild Masters, collecting feedback, understanding status and overseeing their growth and success in their teams.
Build an internal developer community, encouraging people to speak and present their efforts, share knowledge and give inspiration to others.
Create and improve the onboarding programs of new developers and junior/interns programs, working together with the core teams and mentors on updating content.
Manage the recruiting efforts for the FED guild, keep improving our recruitment process, lead the interviewers team and work closely with HR.
Keep innovating and pushing on how to enable Wix engineering growth at scale.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group with an engineering culture that embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems that support Wix’s over 190 million users. We work in small teams, follow agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our product.
We believe that architects (we call them guild masters) have to be 100% hands on developers. These are the professionals who spend most of their time helping to launch new products, solving architectural issues, and taking responsibility for recruiting, onboarding and mentoring new frontend developers. They are also an important part of the infrastructure team, which is responsible for creating tools that make developers more productive.
You are:
An exceptional frontend developer who always wants to know how things work. You’re on expert level when it comes to the latest JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Vue, etc), tools (Babel, Webpack, Gulp) and languages (Typescript, ES6).
You’re a people person who loves sharing knowledge and best practices, and you’re an independent self learner, who’s also a great team player.
Got experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Delivery? That’s a bonus!
As a Guild Master, you will:
Be responsible for growing web and JavaScript technology.
Mentor new guild members.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers, while getting hands-on experience in Wix’s many teams.
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Write TDD and clean code.
Contribute to the engineering culture and methodologies of Wix.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group. We have a development culture that is transparent, highly technical and agile. We develop and maintain highly scalable systems that support Wix’s hundreds of millions of users—and the people who visit their websites. Our team leaders set the tone and standard of our developer-centric culture. They are also mentors of engineers, helping them better themselves, both in terms of technical and human skills, through pair-programming, coaching and mentorship.
You are:
A leader who is able to create a vision for your team and lead people throughout its execution. You have at least 4 years of experience in leading a team of 3 or more developers, and you want to mentor other engineers. You’re passionate, intelligent and unafraid to share your opinions when appropriate–but you’re also humble and respectful of the opinions of others.
You have at least 5-6 years or experience in Javascript, HTML5, CSS and you're familiar with FED technologies and frameworks (Angular/React/Vue, Grunt/Gulp/Webpack). You’ve written production-grade code and are allergic to ugly and unmaintainable code. You’re familiar with software engineering best practices (testing, code reviews, pair-programming, etc.) and are aware of bad practices and anti-patterns.
Bonus points if you have developed, designed and maintained highly available and large scale production systems, or if you’re skilled in continuous integration, continuous delivery and TDD.
As an FED Team Leader, you will:
Recruit top talented developers to our group.
Mentor and advise the team in code review, pair-programming and more.
See the big picture of group tasks in order to make the best decisions about priorities.
Share knowledge between your team and other teams in the group.  
Discover the technical debt & challenges and assist in solving them.
Interact with stakeholders outside of the group.
Work as a part of the team in hands-on development at least 80% of the time.

We are:
Editor X, the best professional website builder in the world for designers, agencies & pro creators. We offer a superior creation experience with advanced design and layout capabilities, so you can create complex website designs for any device. It includes CSS technologies like Grid, Flexbox and custom breakpoints - all with intuitive drag and drop.
We're a mixed team of senior Wix veterans bringing our shared experiences to ensure we build a robust, well-engineered, and extendable website builder. We have a super-cool micro-frontend architecture that enables us to build an awesome product, running really fast while ensuring great quality.
Some of our challenges include providing a smooth and fast editing experience (60fps) in the browser, integrating with basically every company in Wix, abstracting complex design capabilities by smart heuristics and providing a platform to enable other teams to easily integrate with us.
You are:
A leader who is able to create a vision for your team and lead people throughout its execution. You have at least 3 years’ experience in leading a team of 3 or more developers, and mentoring is your second nature. You’re passionate, intelligent and unafraid to share your opinions when appropriate–but are also humble and respectful of the opinions of others.
An experienced FED or Full-Stack engineer with excellent communication and extreme ownership, you have at least 5-6 years’ experience in Javascript, HTML5, CSS and you're familiar with FED technologies and frameworks (Angular/React/Vue, Grunt/Gulp/Webpack). You’re also familiar with software engineering best practices (testing, code reviews, pair-programming, etc.) and are aware of bad practices and anti-patterns.
Bonus points if you have developed, designed and maintained highly available and large scale production systems, or if you’re skilled in continuous integration, continuous delivery and TDD.
As as an Editor X TL you will:
Mentor and advise the team in code review, pair-programming and more.
See the big picture of group tasks in order to make the best decisions about priorities.
Share knowledge between your team and other teams in the group.
Interact with stakeholders outside of the group.
Work as a part of the team in hands-on development at least 70% of the time.
Take part in solving hard problems, both technical and product-wise that will require creativity and deep domain understanding.
Help with recruiting efforts.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group with an engineering culture that embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems that support Wix’s over 190 million users. We work in small teams, follow Agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our product.
You are:
An ambitious, experienced Backend Developer with JavaScript experience who’s excited at the prospect of entering the world of Frontend. You’re fluent in server-side technologies (NodeJS, Java, .NET, Python, Ruby), and you’re an expert in databases such as MongoDB, MySQL, Cassandra, etc. If you have experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Delivery, that’s a bonus.
 You’re also a self-learner who is independent but a great team player!
As a Fullstack JavaScript Developer, you will:
Become a frontend master as part of our amazing Frontend Engineering team.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Write TDD and clean code.

Fullstack Team Leader - DevPortal
Join our Developer Experience (DevEx) group. Our vision is for all Wix Developers to be highly effective at coding, building, CI-ing/CD-ing and post production management, no matter how big we grow. We strive to increase developer velocity in a world of exponentially rising complexity.
As a Fullstack Team Leader you’ll build a strong team of engineers from scratch, develop workflows and methodologies and choose the technologies you’ll be using in order to build a pluggable Developer Portal to facilitate all the different engineering groups’ needs in a single place.
By applying to this position, you’ll be automatically considered for other fullstack engineering openings at Wix. We’ll be minded to your preference, but we may end up offering you other opportunities that seem to us like a good fit.
What You’ll Do
Assemble a team of developers and create workflows and methodologies for it
Choose the cutting edge technologies the team will be using
Collaborate with developers from different groups within Wix
Create the product’s roadmap together with the group’s Product Manager
Prioritize tasks and set deadlines
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of experience as a team leader
Good understanding of Frontend technologies (JavaScript, TypeScript, React, CSS etc.)
Solid knowledge in Backend (node.js, JVM)
Good understanding of architecture and design
A passion for hands-on coding - an advantage
To succeed in this role you need to be a smart and assertive people’s person who’s focused on leading your team to realize a common vision. You’ll be working closely with developers from different groups in Wix, so good communication skills and the ability to prioritize your team's schedules and goals are a must.
Being a Fullstack Team Leader at Wix
Our development culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems. We follow Agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our products.
Our Fullstack Team Leaders enjoy:
Being part of Wix’s Frontend engineering guild - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your success and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects
Contribution to Open Source projects and community
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 190M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.

Join us to create developer tools that dramatically improve the productivity of hundreds of Wix developers, and make a direct and immediate impact on the way developers work.
The tools we make enable all Wix developers to create our industry leading products faster than ever and to rapidly push them to production. Our new and small team is a place to grow and develop your knowledge and abilities, working with experienced developers, for developers. Starting from the kick off, and all the way to deployment - this is a dev-centric environment in which you’ll be involved in all stages.
What You’ll Do
Create resilient developer tools that provide an amazing developer experience to Wix developers
Design and develop API’s for other teams who are building developer tools at Wix
Become an expert in developer tools in the Javascript ecosystem
Identify developer challenges, work with internal stakeholders to specify and scope optimal solutions and deliver robust tools for hundreds of developers
Be responsible for the design and architecture aspects of your work
Release your code to production on a daily basis - we work in CI/CD methods
Own, test, and deploy your code. Owning it means also waking up at night when something needs an immediate response
What We’re Looking For
4+ years of experience in Javascript - a must
At least 1 year of Node.js or Backend engineering experience
Cloud infrastructure experience - an advantage
Experience in creating development tools - an advantage
To be successful in this role you need to have interpersonal skills and a service oriented mindset, as you’ll be working with many internal clients and interfaces within the company. Due to the large number of projects and requirements, you’ll need to demonstrate a great time management and the ability to prioritize tasks. You’ll also need to be open minded to constant change, while enjoying trust and full ownership.
Being an Engineer at Wix
Our development culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems. We follow Agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our products.
Our engineers enjoy:
Being part of Wix Engineering - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your success and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 200M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.
By applying to this position, you’ll be automatically considered for other engineering openings at Wix. We’ll be minded to your preference, but we may end up offering you other opportunities that seem to us like a good fit.

We are:
The innovation team of Wix that creates new and visionary solutions for the web. Our current project is building a platform that fosters collaboration between developers and UX designers by using the same tool.
Our tech challenges include automatic analysis of complex non-opinionated codebases to create various useful tools for manipulating, testing, and editing.
You are:
A talented senior developer with 5+ years experience who is excited about cutting edge technologies and has a passion for code static/dynamic analysis and code transformation.
As a Static Analysis Engineer, you will:
Work with TypeScriept ASTs (Abstract Syntax Tree) to analyze and manipulate TS/JS code
Work on automation generation of JSON schemas of types
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers
Write tested and clean code
Advantage: previous experience with web technologies

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. 
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices, handling daily traffic of about 170 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. We invest 20% of our time in personal-professional development and improving our craftsmanship. 
You are:
An awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 3 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of OOP, SOLID and know functional programming principles. You care about design, passionate about TDD methodology and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently. 
You’re flexible and willing to adjust to context changes. Plus, you’re an open-minded self-learner, trying to keep in touch with what happens around you. You want to play in the team and help it succeed. People enjoy working with you.
Bonus points if you:
Can understand and write multi-threaded code, specifically a web server's request lifecycle.
Have practiced TDD.
Have an understanding of reactive patterns and toolkits.
Have contributed to open-source software.
Have an excellent understanding of database systems, relational and otherwise, including sharding for big data applications.
Are able to conduct performance analysis for a system and find its bottlenecks.
Have been a “go-to” person in your previous teams/organizations.
Have a get-things-done approach.
As a Backend Engineer, you will:
Solve real complex problems at a high scale.
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Write TDD and clean code.

We are:
The Wix System Engineering team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture of the company, network and security standards, and maintaining our global infrastructure in data centers spanning around the globe. We design, develop and operate services and components that engineering relies on to deliver solutions to Wix.
We are looking for a software engineer that will help our team to improve our production environment’s resiliency.
  You are:
An experienced engineer that has an in-depth understanding of OOP and SOLID design principles (if you know functional programming concepts - that’s awesome), care about system design, testability, maintainability of your code in the long run. You have a working knowledge of Python and Go, but knowledge of any other programming languages is an advantage (Node.js, Javascript, Scala, Clojure, Rust maybe?), cloud platforms (AWS or GCP). If you can explain the following terms to us - we definitely want to talk to you: distributed systems, CAP, eventual consistency, microservice-based architectures.
As a Software Engineer, you will:
Investigate issues, from typos to non-googleable TCP stack peculiarities.
Write code, ranging from simple clean-up scripts to highly-loaded user-facing applications.
Collaborate with software and system engineers to deliver new features for our deployment and traffic routing infrastructure.
Define ways for making Wix services more resilient

Join our Identity group - one of the newest, fastest growing teams at Wix to help us solve unique distributed system challenges, while working with cutting edge technologies.
We’re responsible for building a state-of-the-art identity management platform across Wix - managing authentication and authorization in a highly rich & complex high-scale microservices environment. We’re facilitating each and every server developer at our company and every incoming request, with over 2 million RPM.
As a Backend Infrastructure Engineer on our team, you’ll come across exciting challenges in design, synchronization, performance and security. You’ll be staying ahead of the curve with the latest infra and work with a fun, diverse team of developers who are making a significant incremental impact each and every day.
What You’ll Do
Build our next generation authentication and authorization (ABAC) solution
Own the full lifecycle - design, implementation, deployment, monitoring and maintenance
Solve tough performance and security challenges
Be in touch with many Wix developers providing them with an infrastructure that both addresses their needs and boosts their velocity
Deploy to production dozens of times a day
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of experience in server-side web development - a must
Experience with microservices architecture and TDD methodology and
Familiarity with common web application vulnerabilities
Knowledge in maintaining critical core production services - a must
Authorization & authentication know-how; building infrastructure; security and participation in threat-models and SDLC - an advantage
Experience with scala, designing, building and maintaining high scale, high performing production services - a big advantage
To succeed in this role you must be curious, with motivation to grow and make an impact in both infrastructure challenges as well as product ones. You’ll need to be passionate about performance and scale, and understanding of many product flows. You’ll also need to have a service-oriented mindset and seek to see the big picture & continually expand your knowledge, expertise and impact across Wix.
Being a Backend Engineer at Wix
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of over 1,300 microservices.
Our backend developers enjoy:
Being part of Wix’s Backend engineering guild - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your succeed and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects.
Contribution to Open Source projects and community
Personal presentation skills training (blog writing, podcasts, public speaking)
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 190M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.

We are:
Wix’s Document Management team, where lead developers shape the architecture of our future backend microservices and the rich frontend layer that exposes them. We work on some of the most important and critical services at Wix, developing and maintaining highly scalable systems that support Wix’s 192+ million users and the people who visit their websites. Our development culture is transparent, highly technical and agile. Because we ship often, we’ve adopted a continuous delivery and test-driven development (TDD).
Our group is responsible for creating the json defining the users sites which helps the viewer render the live sites; handling the business logic of all Wix editors and exposing  API to verticals/editors for manipulating the document.
Our Team contains full stack and backend developers.  We code the backend using Node.js and the frontend in javascript.

You are:
A passionate experienced developer who’s fluent with server-side technologies and has experience in Node.js working on production servers. You can reason and communicate your opinions, as well as accept others’ approaches. You’re proactive, never taking the present state for granted and always striving to understand why things are done the way they are.
You’re a clean coder with readable, beautiful and maintainable code. You recognize bad code and continuously search for better solutions. You’re deeply familiar with the tools, libraries and frameworks you’ve worked with, and with the POSIX production environment. You’re also able to debug and investigate production issues.
Bonus points if you have:
Demonstrated performance improvement for a system based on performance analysis
Practiced TDD
A good understanding of database systems, relational and otherwise, including sharding for big data applications

As a Backend Developer, you will:
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them
Push your code to millions of users every day
Write TDD and clean code

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our senior software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. 
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices, handling daily traffic of about 170 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. We invest 20% of our time in personal-professional development and improving our craftsmanship. 
You are:
A passionate team player with at least 5 years’ experience, who can reason and communicate your opinions, as well as accept others’ approaches. You’re proactive, never taking the present state for granted and always striving to understand why things are done the way they are. You’re a clean coder with readable, simple, and maintainable code. You recognize bad code and continuously search for better solutions. 
You quickly grasp large & complex systems and their inner workings. You’re experienced with software engineering best practices (testing, code reviews, immutability, etc) and are aware of bad practices and anti-patterns. You’re deeply familiar with the tools, libraries, and frameworks that you’ve worked with and feel at home in a POSIX production environment. You’re also able to debug and investigate production issues.
Bonus points if you:
Understand and write multi-threaded code, specifically a web server's request lifecycle.
Have practiced TDD.
Have an understanding of reactive patterns and toolkits.
Have contributed to open-source software.
Have spoken at developer meetups, conferences or have a blog about software engineering.
Have an excellent understanding of database systems, relational and otherwise, including sharding for big data applications.
Are able to conduct performance analysis for a system and find its bottlenecks.
Have been a “go-to” person in your previous teams/organizations.
  As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will:
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Solve hard problems in a simple way using TDD and clean code.
Influence the developer community.
Contribute to the OSS community. 
We strive to hire engineers who embrace excellence, have ‘fire and forget’ abilities, and who are independent, innovative, and bold.

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our core guild engineers solve some of the most challenging internet-scale problems that exist today.
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
About the team:
We’re a small team of experienced developers. In our day-to-day, we build core services that design to handle Wix’s real-time traffic. We always strive to simplify our services and APIs to enable us scale horizontally and have better resiliency. We are writing highly concurrent code in Scala and focusing mainly on caching and performance optimization.
Our Challenges:
Our services handle traffic of over 1.5 million RPM across multiple data centers and using multiple cloud vendors. Our main challenge is to constantly improve performance and optimize flows at Wix, for our 170 million users, both as site visitors and editors. 
We measure everything using sophisticated AB testing tools, evolving to new technologies to support the always growing scale, and leading common practices in the guild, such as how to write asynchronous and highly concurrent code. 
What we’re looking for:
An experienced engineer with at least 2 years coding in Scala, experience with maintaining critical core production services. Outstanding technical and soft skills, being able to communicate and assist others, with the ability to dive into the details, investigating the root cause and applying common sense.
Bonus points to engineers with experience with site rendering flows/networking, performance, and optimization.

We are:
Wix’s Data team - over 250 Big Data Engineers, Data Engineers, Business Analysts and Data Scientists who believe in using analytics to understand & improve how users interact with our products. With 192+ million users, we collect over a billion events a day – that’s 1TB of data added daily! We use cutting edge technologies to process, store and query our data, with tools we develop ourselves as well as technologies like Hadoop and Presto.
You are:
An independent, self-learner who understands business processes and able to translate business needs into data models. You're a detail-oriented individual with a track record of success in quantitative fields. You can write complex SQL queries and can implement data pipelines and ETL processes.
Bonus points if you have basic knowledge in big data and the Hadoop ecosystem.
As a BI developer, you will:
Be responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining data pipelines from different sources
Design, implement and support robust, scalable solutions to enhance business analysis capabilities, identify gaps and design processes to fill them
Work with analysts and product managers to understand business priorities and translate requirements into data models
Collaborate with various stakeholders across the company like data engineers, analysts, data science, finance, etc., in order to deliver team tasks
Collaborate with a broad forum of experts and stakeholders, including architects and engineers, to create high-quality deliverables
Own the data development process end-to-end including business understanding, methodology, QA and maintenance

We are:
Wix.com’s Systems team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture and requirements of the company, and work to monitor, manage and maintain our global Wix infrastructure. We’re looking for a solution oriented Networking Engineer to join our professional team.
You are:
A DevOps/System Engineer with 3-4 years’ experience including networking. You have practical skills and experience working with networking equipment like CISCO, Juniper, F5, Fortigate, Arista, open-software solutions (VyOS,pFsense,etc) and have a full understanding in routing protocols (e.g. BGP, OSPF, etc), VPN/GRE tunneling, as well as strong networking foundations in TCP/IP, DNS, Load-balancers, Network Security and a whole lot more.

Experience in Docker or other container-based technologies.
Experience with SQL/NoSQL technologies like MySQL, ElasticSearch, etc.
Experience with monitoring tools. 
CCNP/CCIE or any other equal certification from other vendors (Juniper/Arista/etc).
As a Networking Engineer, you will:
Build multi-data center architecture with hundreds of servers. 
Quickly identify and resolve infrastructural problems related to networking stack.

Drive the success of our systems’ advancements, cooperating with the development, support and QA teams. 
Define Wix’s network automation and take an active part in making it happen.
Analyze existing tools and automation frameworks. 
Design and implement (hands-on) the next generation of tools to be used and networking changes to be implemented to assure stability, increase velocity, and enhance users’ experience by optimizing networking stack.
Be a member of the Systems team and participate in on-call duties (1 week every few months).
Make sure that our network services across the entire company are effective, seamless and easy to use.
Be a part of Wix’s innovative culture, which includes proposing, convincing and executing any activity that you find contributes to Wix’s success.

Our R&D department has more than 100 production changes a day - that’s over 2,000 a month! Situated in the middle of this fast-paced development environment, our Systems team has to work both independently and together with others. 
We're looking for a bright, solution-oriented System Engineer to join the team and build, run, manage and monitor security aspects of our cloud-based and physical environments.
You are:
As a Platform Production Engineer with 4+ years of experience in live production systems. As a System Engineer, you will:

We are:
Wix’s IT Engineering team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture of Wix, and developing and innovating enterprise solutions to fit Wix needs. We design network and security standards, and maintain our global infrastructure. We’re also responsible for the design, development, and operation of security services and components across Wix.
You are:
A Security Engineer with 7+ years of experience in a large enterprise environment. You have strong networking foundations (TCP/IP, DNS, Load-balancers, network security), a solid understanding of technologies and protocols like LDAP, DNS, PKI, IdP brokering and federation, and experience with at least one major cloud platform such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
You also have experience with SSO solutions such as RH-SSO, Okta, Google SAML and Azure Authentication, and your knowledge and expertise includes software development methodologies, corporate security data and Zero-Trust solutions.
You have a good understanding of web application vulnerabilities, application authentication and authorization protocols, application security methodologies, secret management, PKI and SSL/TLS. You’re self- motivated and you possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Development experience in Java, Python, GoLang, NodeJS and experience with Docker, K8s or other container-based technologies are advantages.
You’ll also get bonus points if you have experience with automation/configuration management using tools like Terraform, Ansible or an equivalent, and an understanding of the CI/CD methodology and version controlling.
As a Senior Security Engineer, you will:
Design and develop security applications on top of device management
Design and implement different kinds of authentication sequences
Design and implement AI models on top of operation data
Assists with the execution of architecture blueprints and bring security into a DevOps  mindset and culture
Collaborate with product teams to support the evaluation of planned changes and  to minimize security risks
Provide advice on security issues and contribute to the development of different projects and products
Drive the development of new security capabilities to support delivery and ensure that the tools and approaches used are effective
Be a part of Wix’s innovative culture and proactively contribute to our success

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. 
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices, handling daily traffic of about 170 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. We invest 20% of our time in personal-professional development and improving our craftsmanship. 
You are:
An awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 3 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of OOP, SOLID and know functional programming principles. You care about design, passionate about TDD methodology and microservices architecture, take responsibility and can work independently. 
You’re flexible and willing to adjust to context changes. Plus, you’re an open-minded self-learner, trying to keep in touch with what happens around you. You want to play in the team and help it succeed. People enjoy working with you.
Bonus points if you:
Can understand and write multi-threaded code, specifically a web server's request lifecycle.
Have practiced TDD.
Have an understanding of reactive patterns and toolkits.
Have contributed to open-source software.
Have an excellent understanding of database systems, relational and otherwise, including sharding for big data applications.
Are able to conduct performance analysis for a system and find its bottlenecks.
Have been a “go-to” person in your previous teams/organizations.
Have a get-things-done approach.
As a Backend Engineer, you will:
Solve real complex problems at a high scale.
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Write TDD and clean code.

We are:
The Wix System Engineering team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture of the company, network and security standards, and maintaining our global infrastructure in data centers spanning around the globe. We design, develop and operate services and components that engineering relies on to deliver solutions to Wix.
We are looking for a software engineer that will help our team to improve our production environment’s resiliency.
  You are:
An experienced engineer that has an in-depth understanding of OOP and SOLID design principles (if you know functional programming concepts - that’s awesome), care about system design, testability, maintainability of your code in the long run. You have a working knowledge of Python and Go, but knowledge of any other programming languages is an advantage (Node.js, Javascript, Scala, Clojure, Rust maybe?), cloud platforms (AWS or GCP). If you can explain the following terms to us - we definitely want to talk to you: distributed systems, CAP, eventual consistency, microservice-based architectures.
As a Software Engineer, you will:
Investigate issues, from typos to non-googleable TCP stack peculiarities.
Write code, ranging from simple clean-up scripts to highly-loaded user-facing applications.
Collaborate with software and system engineers to deliver new features for our deployment and traffic routing infrastructure.
Define ways for making Wix services more resilient

Join our Identity group - one of the newest, fastest growing teams at Wix to help us solve unique distributed system challenges, while working with cutting edge technologies.
We’re responsible for building a state-of-the-art identity management platform across Wix - managing authentication and authorization in a highly rich & complex high-scale microservices environment. We’re facilitating each and every server developer at our company and every incoming request, with over 2 million RPM.
As a Backend Infrastructure Engineer on our team, you’ll come across exciting challenges in design, synchronization, performance and security. You’ll be staying ahead of the curve with the latest infra and work with a fun, diverse team of developers who are making a significant incremental impact each and every day.
What You’ll Do
Build our next generation authentication and authorization (ABAC) solution
Own the full lifecycle - design, implementation, deployment, monitoring and maintenance
Solve tough performance and security challenges
Be in touch with many Wix developers providing them with an infrastructure that both addresses their needs and boosts their velocity
Deploy to production dozens of times a day
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of experience in server-side web development - a must
Experience with microservices architecture and TDD methodology and
Familiarity with common web application vulnerabilities
Knowledge in maintaining critical core production services - a must
Authorization & authentication know-how; building infrastructure; security and participation in threat-models and SDLC - an advantage
Experience with scala, designing, building and maintaining high scale, high performing production services - a big advantage
To succeed in this role you must be curious, with motivation to grow and make an impact in both infrastructure challenges as well as product ones. You’ll need to be passionate about performance and scale, and understanding of many product flows. You’ll also need to have a service-oriented mindset and seek to see the big picture & continually expand your knowledge, expertise and impact across Wix.
Being a Backend Engineer at Wix
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of over 1,300 microservices.
Our backend developers enjoy:
Being part of Wix’s Backend engineering guild - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your succeed and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects.
Contribution to Open Source projects and community
Personal presentation skills training (blog writing, podcasts, public speaking)
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 190M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group. Our mission is to develop products and technologies that empower any person in the world to thrive online. As an industry leading engineering group, we’re pushing the boundaries of web development to its limits. We build complex micro-frontends with extremely scalable and resilient architectures, which combine into stunning applications running in our customers’ browsers.
Our engineering culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD and clean code. We work in small teams, follow agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly. Our goal is to maintain the highest standards of development, while having fun doing so. And, we love sharing knowledge and contributing back to the open source community.
You are:
An exceptional frontend developer with at least 5 years’ experience working on client-side development on large scales. You’re an expert on the latest JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Vue, etc), tools (Babel, Webpack/Rollup/Parcel) and languages (Typescript, ES6+).

Push your code to millions of users every day.

JobTitle: Frontend Engineer - Stylable Open Source Project
JobRequirements:
We are:
The innovation team of Wix that creates new and cutting-edge solutions for the web. Our current projects include Stylable, a CSS preprocessor enabling developers to write reusable, highly-performant components by extending CSS with a type system.
We’re looking for a full-stack developer to join our innovative team. We love passionate people who are masters of front and back-end technologies, with strong connections to the open-source community.
You are:
A strong developer with 3 years experience and a passion for open source projects. You are an expert at compilation and bundling optimization. You understand how to program IDE language support.
As a Software Developer, you will:
Work on improving our current open source solutions, such as Stylable.
Get involved in the community of users to understand and prioritize future development.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Write tested and clean code.

We are:
Wix Wow! - a team within Wix’s Editor group, dedicated to creating innovative tools and amazing experiences for Wix’s 200 million users. We specialize mostly in graphics and motion, and use every possible technology at our disposal, both in the browser, and beyond. We seek out creative trends in web design and creation, and bring it into the Wix Platform and Editors in the most intuitive way. We value pixels, colors, slick performance and smooth motion. We dabble in videos, images, SVG, CSS, WebGL, and everything else the web has to offer.
You are:
A Frontend Developer, with an orientation for pixels and motion. You know your CSS, and SVG and Canvas are your friends. You know your way around the APIs a browser natively offers, and can write fluent vanilla JavaScript. You can spot frame drops, layouts and color differences, and you’re passionate about creating tools and experiences.
You’re a self learner, and are very motivated to solve problems, both in a team and independently. Creating stuff for the web is your profession, not (just) your job.
As a Frontend Developer for Wix Wow!, you will:
Create jaw-dropping components and effects for the Wix Platform.
Create Editor(s) tools and experiences to create those effects.
Maintain and enhance current products and features created by the team.
Integrate these with other Wix products.
Work in a highly experienced and exclusive team of professionals.
Be free to go wild with creativity.

We are:
The Editor Team at Wix. We serve at the core of the company’s offering - responsible for the code that runs millions of websites built with Wix platform. We ensure the UI makes Wix sites easy to create and maintain. The Editor engineering teams pave the way for innovation in web technologies, working closely with React, Typescript and ES6. Additionally, the team balances between building a product with massive-scale architecture, while guaranteeing its development is quick and fun.
You are:
Passionate about software engineering. You don’t just build websites, you want to be at the center of frontend and full stack development. You’re experienced in frontend/full stack development (preferred), or other high-abstraction technologies such as Java, mobile apps and platforms. You’re also well-versed in computer science fundamentals–copying and pasting CSS snippets from stack-overflows bore you. You want to solve real, software engineering problems.
As a Frontend Engineer, you will:
Manage and complete tasks through TDD, continuous integration and modern development processes.
Write (a lot) of high-quality, functional Javascript. Additionally, you’ll work with Git, Node.js, React, Redux, MobX, ES6 and SASS.
Handle fixes and develop new features for our website viewer platform and Editor UI.
Participate in designing APIs, mechanisms and abstractions for the Wix Editor platform.
Push your limits and challenge your understanding of how to scale frontend development.
Make a powerful and positive impact on over 100 million users.
Have a lot of fun. The Editor Team is AWESOME!

We are:
Wix Engineering’s Frontend management team - we enable the continuous growth of our group while preserving our professional standards, development velocity, cross team communication and developer community feeling on a large scale. The frontend engineering group (aka FED Guild) is made up of 100s of developers working in dozens of teams and growing rapidly. At this kind of volume, we need to be active in solving the question of how we do things at high scale and as we grow the questions keep changing, for example:
How can we define the professional standards we believe in ensure that they are maintained throughout all teams?
How do we foster a culture of sharing knowledge and collaboration and maintain the community feeling in a large organization and not fall into working in silos?
How do we keep recruiting the strongest developers in the industry, onboard dozens of new engineers each year and build for the future by training junior developers and interns?
The Frontend management team sits in Wix’s main offices in Israel, Ukraine & Lithuania. Each manager is responsible for the local efforts in their office and collaborates with the rest of the team on global efforts. Together, we work on managing recruitment, building and maintaining the crash course every developer in Wix goes through, building junior/interns training programs, leading internal community events such as webinars, workshops and temporary swaps between teams which give people wider context. In addition, we lead a cross-Wix forum of developers where each group has at least one representative (aka FED Guild Masters forum), working on defining our standards and maintaining them all over Wix.
You are:
An experienced engineering manager of large teams who comes from a frontend, hands-on architecture background. You’re able to communicate at the highest levels both with group managers and frontend architects. You’re super proactive and innovative, able to think outside the box, recognize the most important problem to solve and relentlessly go at it.
You’re a true visionary, able to lead large groups of developers, set the tone, plan long term strategy and execute towards it. You deal well with the challenges of matrix management, and you’re capable of pleasantly managing the conflicts that arise and find win-win solutions. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in your own language, as well as in English.
As FED Guild Manager, you will:
Lead the frontend engineering group (aka FED Guild) in the Israel offices (Tel Aviv, Be’er Sheva & Haifa).
Define the vision for the FED Guild in Israel, working together with managers and architects to make it happen.
Collaborate with FED Guild Managers from Ukraine and Lithuania on global efforts and vision.
Have a wide understanding of Wix’s roadmap, finding the cross-Wix FED Guild focus in order to promote it.
Manage the forum of developer representatives from all teams (aka FED Guild Masters forum) working together on defining our professional standards and implementing them in their teams.
Maintain close one-on-one relationships with the Guild Masters, collecting feedback, understanding status and overseeing their growth and success in their teams.
Build an internal developer community, encouraging people to speak and present their efforts, share knowledge and give inspiration to others.
Create and improve the onboarding programs of new developers and junior/interns programs, working together with the core teams and mentors on updating content.
Manage the recruiting efforts for the FED guild, keep improving our recruitment process, lead the interviewers team and work closely with HR.
Keep innovating and pushing on how to enable Wix engineering growth at scale.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group with an engineering culture that embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems that support Wix’s over 190 million users. We work in small teams, follow agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our product.
We believe that architects (we call them guild masters) have to be 100% hands on developers. These are the professionals who spend most of their time helping to launch new products, solving architectural issues, and taking responsibility for recruiting, onboarding and mentoring new frontend developers. They are also an important part of the infrastructure team, which is responsible for creating tools that make developers more productive.
You are:
An exceptional frontend developer who always wants to know how things work. You’re on expert level when it comes to the latest JavaScript technologies (React, Angular, Vue, etc), tools (Babel, Webpack, Gulp) and languages (Typescript, ES6).
You’re a people person who loves sharing knowledge and best practices, and you’re an independent self learner, who’s also a great team player.
Got experience in Test Driven Development (TDD) and Continuous Delivery? That’s a bonus!
As a Guild Master, you will:
Be responsible for growing web and JavaScript technology.
Mentor new guild members.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers, while getting hands-on experience in Wix’s many teams.
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Write TDD and clean code.
Contribute to the engineering culture and methodologies of Wix.

We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group. We have a development culture that is transparent, highly technical and agile. We develop and maintain highly scalable systems that support Wix’s hundreds of millions of users—and the people who visit their websites. Our team leaders set the tone and standard of our developer-centric culture. They are also mentors of engineers, helping them better themselves, both in terms of technical and human skills, through pair-programming, coaching and mentorship.
You are:
A leader who is able to create a vision for your team and lead people throughout its execution. You have at least 4 years of experience in leading a team of 3 or more developers, and you want to mentor other engineers. You’re passionate, intelligent and unafraid to share your opinions when appropriate–but you’re also humble and respectful of the opinions of others.
You have at least 5-6 years or experience in Javascript, HTML5, CSS and you're familiar with FED technologies and frameworks (Angular/React/Vue, Grunt/Gulp/Webpack). You’ve written production-grade code and are allergic to ugly and unmaintainable code. You’re familiar with software engineering best practices (testing, code reviews, pair-programming, etc.) and are aware of bad practices and anti-patterns.
Bonus points if you have developed, designed and maintained highly available and large scale production systems, or if you’re skilled in continuous integration, continuous delivery and TDD.
As an FED Team Leader, you will:
Recruit top talented developers to our group.
Mentor and advise the team in code review, pair-programming and more.
See the big picture of group tasks in order to make the best decisions about priorities.
Share knowledge between your team and other teams in the group.  
Discover the technical debt & challenges and assist in solving them.
Interact with stakeholders outside of the group.
Work as a part of the team in hands-on development at least 80% of the time.

We are:
Editor X, the best professional website builder in the world for designers, agencies & pro creators. We offer a superior creation experience with advanced design and layout capabilities, so you can create complex website designs for any device. It includes CSS technologies like Grid, Flexbox and custom breakpoints - all with intuitive drag and drop.
We're a mixed team of senior Wix veterans bringing our shared experiences to ensure we build a robust, well-engineered, and extendable website builder. We have a super-cool micro-frontend architecture that enables us to build an awesome product, running really fast while ensuring great quality.
Some of our challenges include providing a smooth and fast editing experience (60fps) in the browser, integrating with basically every company in Wix, abstracting complex design capabilities by smart heuristics and providing a platform to enable other teams to easily integrate with us.
You are:
A leader who is able to create a vision for your team and lead people throughout its execution. You have at least 3 years’ experience in leading a team of 3 or more developers, and mentoring is your second nature. An experienced FED or Full-Stack engineer with excellent communication and extreme ownership, you have at least 5-6 years’ experience in Javascript, HTML5, CSS and you're familiar with FED technologies and frameworks (Angular/React/Vue, Grunt/Gulp/Webpack). We are:
Wix’s Frontend Engineering group with an engineering culture that embraces cutting-edge technologies, TDD, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems that support Wix’s over 190 million users.  You’re also a self-learner who is independent but a great team player!

Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Write TDD and clean code.

Fullstack Team Leader - DevPortal
Join our Developer Experience (DevEx) group. Our vision is for all Wix Developers to be highly effective at coding, building, CI-ing/CD-ing and post production management, no matter how big we grow. We strive to increase developer velocity in a world of exponentially rising complexity.
As a Fullstack Team Leader you’ll build a strong team of engineers from scratch, develop workflows and methodologies and choose the technologies you’ll be using in order to build a pluggable Developer Portal to facilitate all the different engineering groups’ needs in a single place.
By applying to this position, you’ll be automatically considered for other fullstack engineering openings at Wix. We’ll be minded to your preference, but we may end up offering you other opportunities that seem to us like a good fit.
What You’ll Do
Assemble a team of developers and create workflows and methodologies for it
Choose the cutting edge technologies the team will be using
Collaborate with developers from different groups within Wix
Create the product’s roadmap together with the group’s Product Manager
Prioritize tasks and set deadlines
What We’re Looking For
3+ years of experience as a team leader
Good understanding of Frontend technologies (JavaScript, TypeScript, React, CSS etc.)
Solid knowledge in Backend (node.js, JVM)
Good understanding of architecture and design
A passion for hands-on coding - an advantage
To succeed in this role you need to be a smart and assertive people’s person who’s focused on leading your team to realize a common vision. You’ll be working closely with developers from different groups in Wix, so good communication skills and the ability to prioritize your team's schedules and goals are a must.
Being a Fullstack Team Leader at Wix
Our development culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems. We follow Agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our products.
Our Fullstack Team Leaders enjoy:
Being part of Wix’s Frontend engineering guild - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your success and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects
Contribution to Open Source projects and community
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 190M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.

We are:

With 192+ million users, we collect over a billion events a day – that’s 1TB of data added daily! We use cutting edge technologies to process, store and query our data, with tools we develop ourselves as well as technologies like Hadoop and Presto.

We are:
Wix.com’s Systems team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture and requirements of the company, and work to monitor, manage and maintain our global Wix infrastructure. We’re looking for a solution oriented Networking Engineer to join our professional team.
You are:
A DevOps/System Engineer with 3-4 years’ experience including networking. You have practical skills and experience working with networking equipment like CISCO, Juniper, F5, Fortigate, Arista, open-software solutions (VyOS,pFsense,etc) and have a full understanding in routing protocols (e.g. BGP, OSPF, etc), VPN/GRE tunneling, as well as strong networking foundations in TCP/IP, DNS, Load-balancers, Network Security and a whole lot more. 
You’re also great when it comes to hardware from datacenter equipment to storage and backup systems, and have experience with Private and Public Clouds, as well as hyperconverged solutions. Your experience spans to Linux system internals, Windows, MacOS, shell scripting (bash, sh, etc), scripting languages (JS for Node, Python, Ruby, etc) as well as automation. 
Bonus points if you have:
Experience in Docker or other container-based technologies.
Experience with SQL/NoSQL technologies like MySQL, ElasticSearch, etc.
Experience with monitoring tools. 
CCNP/CCIE or any other equal certification from other vendors (Juniper/Arista/etc).
As a Networking Engineer, you will:
Build multi-data center architecture with hundreds of servers. 
Quickly identify and resolve infrastructural problems related to networking stack. 
Get a chance to work with virtually all aspects of our rapidly-developing infrastructure.
Drive the success of our systems’ advancements, cooperating with the development, support and QA teams. 
Define Wix’s network automation and take an active part in making it happen.
Analyze existing tools and automation frameworks. 
Design and implement (hands-on) the next generation of tools to be used and networking changes to be implemented to assure stability, increase velocity, and enhance users’ experience by optimizing networking stack.
Be a member of the Systems team and participate in on-call duties (1 week every few months).
Make sure that our network services across the entire company are effective, seamless and easy to use.
Be a part of Wix’s innovative culture, which includes proposing, convincing and executing any activity that you find contributes to Wix’s success.

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our senior software engineers shape the architecture of our backend microservices. 
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices, handling daily traffic of about 170 million users. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
Our developer-centric approach places responsibility, ownership, and trust on each developer on their path to production. Our culture is transparent, highly technical, and agile. We invest 20% of our time in personal-professional development and improving our craftsmanship.

A passionate team player with at least 5 years’ experience, who can reason and communicate your opinions, as well as accept others’ approaches. You quickly grasp large & complex systems and their inner workings. You’re experienced with software engineering best practices (testing, code reviews, immutability, etc) and are aware of bad practices and anti-patterns. You’re deeply familiar with the tools, libraries, and frameworks that you’ve worked with and feel at home in a POSIX production environment. You’re also able to debug and investigate production issues.

Understand and write multi-threaded code, specifically a web server's request lifecycle.
Have practiced TDD.
Have an understanding of reactive patterns and toolkits.
Have contributed to open-source software.
Have spoken at developer meetups, conferences or have a blog about software engineering.
Have an excellent understanding of database systems, relational and otherwise, including sharding for big data applications.
Are able to conduct performance analysis for a system and find its bottlenecks.
Have been a “go-to” person in your previous teams/organizations.
  As a Senior Backend Engineer, you will:
Work on cutting-edge technologies and become an industry leader.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Push your code to millions of users every day.
Solve hard problems in a simple way using TDD and clean code.
Influence the developer community.
Contribute to the OSS community. 
We strive to hire engineers who embrace excellence, have ‘fire and forget’ abilities, and who are independent, innovative, and bold.

We are:
Wix’s Backend Engineering group, where our core guild engineers solve some of the most challenging internet-scale problems that exist today.
Due to our high scale, we run our production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, managing an ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices. This introduces unique distributed system challenges of synchronization, performance, testing, and monitoring while working with cutting edge technologies.
About the team:
We’re a small team of experienced developers. In our day-to-day, we build core services that design to handle Wix’s real-time traffic. We always strive to simplify our services and APIs to enable us scale horizontally and have better resiliency. We are writing highly concurrent code in Scala and focusing mainly on caching and performance optimization.
Our Challenges:
Our services handle traffic of over 1.5 million RPM across multiple data centers and using multiple cloud vendors. Our main challenge is to constantly improve performance and optimize flows at Wix, for our 170 million users, both as site visitors and editors. 
We measure everything using sophisticated AB testing tools, evolving to new technologies to support the always growing scale, and leading common practices in the guild, such as how to write asynchronous and highly concurrent code. 
What we’re looking for:
An experienced engineer with at least 2 years coding in Scala, experience with maintaining critical core production services. Outstanding technical and soft skills, being able to communicate and assist others, with the ability to dive into the details, investigating the root cause and applying common sense.
Bonus points to engineers with experience with site rendering flows/networking, performance, and optimization.
