Our development culture embraces cutting-edge technologies, performance and clean code for our highly scalable systems. We follow Agile work methods and use continuous integration and continuous delivery methodologies to run quickly while maintaining the high quality of our products.
Our engineers enjoy:
Being part of Wix Engineering - belonging to a professional community that is dedicated to your success and personal growth
Ongoing training, workshops and time to learn and work on cross-company projects
Collaboration with teams and engineers from Wix offices around the world
Working at Wix
Join us to work in one of the most exciting companies in the world, serving over 200M users worldwide. This is a chance to be part of a fast growing, dynamic, fun and creative environment. You’ll work with an amazing group of professionals who are also great people, with whom you can do extraordinary things.
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Wix was built around the idea that everyone has the right to be successful, online. This same vision defines us as an employer: creating a work environment where everyone is welcomed and anyone has the right to succeed.
By applying to this position, you’ll be automatically considered for other engineering openings at Wix. We’ll be minded to your preference, but we may end up offering you other opportunities that seem to us like a good fit.

We are:
The innovation team of Wix that creates new and visionary solutions for the web. Our current project is building a platform that fosters collaboration between developers and UX designers by using the same tool.
Our tech challenges include automatic analysis of complex non-opinionated codebases to create various useful tools for manipulating, testing, and editing.
You are:
A talented senior developer with 5+ years experience who is excited about cutting edge technologies and has a passion for code static/dynamic analysis and code transformation.
As a Static Analysis Engineer, you will:
Work with TypeScriept ASTs (Abstract Syntax Tree) to analyze and manipulate TS/JS code
Work on automation generation of JSON schemas of types
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers
Write tested and clean code
Advantage: previous experience with web technologies

We are:
Wix’s IT Engineering team. We’re responsible for defining the system architecture of Wix, and developing and innovating enterprise solutions to fit Wix needs. We design network and security standards, and maintain our global infrastructure. We’re also responsible for the design, development, and operation of security services and components across Wix.
You are:
A Security Engineer with 7+ years of experience in a large enterprise environment. You have strong networking foundations (TCP/IP, DNS, Load-balancers, network security), a solid understanding of technologies and protocols like LDAP, DNS, PKI, IdP brokering and federation, and experience with at least one major cloud platform such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
You also have experience with SSO solutions such as RH-SSO, Okta, Google SAML and Azure Authentication, and your knowledge and expertise includes software development methodologies, corporate security data and Zero-Trust solutions.
You have a good understanding of web application vulnerabilities, application authentication and authorization protocols, application security methodologies, secret management, PKI and SSL/TLS. You’re self- motivated and you possess excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Development experience in Java, Python, GoLang, NodeJS and experience with Docker, K8s or other container-based technologies are advantages.
You’ll also get bonus points if you have experience with automation/configuration management using tools like Terraform, Ansible or an equivalent, and an understanding of the CI/CD methodology and version controlling.
As a Senior Security Engineer, you will:
Design and develop security applications on top of device management
Design and implement different kinds of authentication sequences
Design and implement AI models on top of operation data
Assists with the execution of architecture blueprints and bring security into a DevOps  mindset and culture
Collaborate with product teams to support the evaluation of planned changes and  to minimize security risks
Provide advice on security issues and contribute to the development of different projects and products
Drive the development of new security capabilities to support delivery and ensure that the tools and approaches used are effective
Be a part of Wix’s innovative culture and proactively contribute to our success

We are:

If you have the skills and the drive, join us!
You are:
A writer who’s comfortable with programming. You have experience documenting APIs and have written developer-level documentation. You can explain complex concepts to a non-technical audience, and have at least 5 years’ experience writing professional-level content in perfect English.
As a Technical Writer, you will:
Document APIs at an appropriate level for various audiences.
Create code examples.
Write highly-technical and user-friendly topics.
Transition easily between projects.
Work independently and proactively with multiple stakeholders.

Wix.com’s mobile group - we develop the Wix mobile app, enabling our users to manage their business from the convenience of their mobile phone, anytime and anywhere. Our group consists of 100+ mobile developers spread across 30+ teams working independently on the same mobile application. We create fun, beautiful products that have a meaningful impact on millions of people around the world.
We’re looking for an experienced developer who wants to step up and make a stronger impact; a passionate leader of change, who’ll dare to use their technical skills to shape the way Wix does automation.

A developer with at least 4 years’ experience in programming
Hands-on experience with mobile automation tools, such as Appium, Robotium UIAutomation frameworks
You value code quality, coding standards, testing tools and the importance of using a state-of-the-art automation
Experienced in creating test automation scripts from test-cases
A deep understanding of testing methodologies and best practices
Solid communication and interpersonal skills
Great if you have:
Experience with continuous integration/deployment
Bachelor’s degree in CS Engineering or related field
Experienced in mobile development

We are: 
The DeviantArt team. Founded in August 2000, DeviantArt is the largest online social network for artists and art enthusiasts, and a platform for emerging and established artists to exhibit, promote, and share their work with an enthusiastic, art-centric community. We have over 44 million registered members and attract over 50 million unique visitors per month. Our members — known as deviants — upload thousands of pieces of original artwork every day, everything from painting and sculpture to digital art, pixel art, films, and anime.
You are:
A talented designer with 3+ years of experience, designing digital products for web and mobile web. You have in-depth knowledge and skill in brand design, UI and icons and a passion for interaction design. You understand the full product life cycle: from research and inspiration to mocks, prototypes,  design, product-launch and user feedback. 
You have a deep understanding of the Adobe Suite programs, Figma/ Sketch, and experience working with a design system. If you have Illustrator, 3D, principle, motion and after effects skills, that’s a major plus! 
You have strong verbal and written communication skills (in English) and proven experience working and collaborating with team members to create stunning products. You’re a team player who knows how to collaborate and brainstorm with all kinds of people with different skills. You’re self-motivated and you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You have a sense for extraordinary, pixel-perfect design solutions. 
A Bachelor of Design in Visual Communication or Interactive Design isn’t a must-have, but it will definitely count in your favor.
Last but not least, you’re looking for a full-time job (not freelance).
As a UI & Brand Designer, you will:
Be at the forefront of DeviantArt's brand, creating and implementing our guidelines and reaching millions of users each day
Create beautiful design assets while always staying true to our brand identity
Take ownership of each project from the first ink drop to the last pixel
Be involved in every aspect of the product development process – from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch
Collaborate daily with product managers, UX designers, content writers and software developers to define, design and deliver extraordinary products that meet users’ needs and business goals
Design inventive product experiences that are fun, elegant and intuitive for millions of people
Conduct a full design cycle from collecting inspiration through creating a pixel perfect UI for all states and scenarios, and deliver to development
Give and receive feedback from other designers in our team in order to continually raise our bar for quality
Learn about our users intent, analyze user behavior and cater to their needs
Approach design holistically across its varying levels – workflow, experience, functional, interaction, and visual – to provide great products

JobTitle: Experienced Product Design Team Lead (UX & UI)
JobRequirements:
We are:
The UX group at Wix. We define and design products that impact over 200 million users around the world. Our team is made up of 160+ talented product designers, working in small teams and following our own UX methodologies. We guide the vision and design for the best user experience, serving millions of businesses all across the world.
We’re looking for a UX Team Lead who’s passionate about solving complex problems at a high-scale, using data and research to validate ideas, bringing solutions that are intuitive and easy to use.
You are:
A UX team lead with 3+ years of experience managing or leading design teams. You have excellent communication and organizational skills and experience working closely with stakeholders, product managers, data analytics and R&D. You have the proven ability to succeed in agile environments with deep appreciation for pixel-perfect products and deep knowledge of all areas of user experience design: research, information architecture, interaction design, UI design, testing, prototype engineering & content.
As a UX Team Lead, you will:
Lead and mentor a team of UX Designers by example through an iterative design process.
Lead the creation, maintenance and improvement of experiences within the technical constraints and principles of UX design.
Manage and prioritize features based on business objectives, user insights and daily operations.
Conduct extensive product research based on support tickets, data, competitor analysis, usability testing and more.
Conduct a full design cycle from collecting inspiration through creating a pixel-perfect UI for all states and scenarios, and deliver to development.
Analyze data and conduct usability sessions with real users.
Collaborate with product managers, developers and other partners to achieve company’s goals.
If this sounds like you, we’d love to get your CV and a portfolio of your work.

We are:
The Innovation team at Wix - we create new and visionary solutions for the web. Our current project is building a cutting-edge platform that fosters collaboration between developers and UX designers by using the same tool.
We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our innovative team. We love passionate people who are masters of UX and are technology-oriented and have strong communication, organizational and analytical skills.
You are:
A Product Designer with at least 3+ years of experience in UX and interactive design within product teams. You have a good understanding of HTML and CSS (bonus point: JS) and have designed complex product interfaces. You’re a master of design tools such as Sketch and you’re detailed oriented.
A great communicator who loves to solve complex product problems by collaborating with a technically oriented team of developers and product managers on a daily basis. You’re able to understand complicated concepts and express them into a clear and good user experience.
As a Senior Product Designer (UX & UI), you will:
Be part of a small UX team that defines a new product from scratch
Work in a dynamic environment that builds a new product for web development teams
Collaborate daily with UX designers, Product Managers, and Software Developers to define, design, and deliver visionary products
Conduct extensive product research
Conduct a full design cycle: from getting inspired through creating a pixel-perfect UI for all states and scenarios, and deliver to development
Analyze data and conduct usability sessions with real users, once a product is launched
Please send a portfolio of your work along with your CV.

We are:
The Business Analysts group at Wix. We’re the people who leverage the power of data to make a huge impact on our products and business plans. We partner with all business and product units at Wix - with the goal of transforming data to ideas that can help our users succeed.
As Business Analysts in a data-driven company, we play a strategic role in shaping business and product decisions. We help planning and prioritizing based on the analysis of impact and potential, and bring clarity and certainty with our models and predictions.
We’re looking for a curious, proactive analyst who loves crunching numbers and coming up with original insights. The kind of person who’s looking to have ownership of their projects, voice their ideas, and see them come to life.
You are:
An analyst with 1-2 years of hands-on experience in data analytics
Experienced with large data sets and quantitative analysis
Driven by business goals, with a deep understanding of business KPIs
Results driven, with the knowledge of A/B testing best practices, and the ability to reach quick insights based on them
Experienced with SQL and data visualization tools such as Presto, Tableau and Power BI - an advantage
Experienced working at an internet or product company - an advantage
Good presentation skills and proficiency in English are key to this role
We’re looking for a curious, proactive analyst who loves crunching numbers and coming up with original insights. The kind of person who’s looking to have ownership of their projects, voice their ideas, and see them come to life.
Since you’ll be working with leadership and senior management, you should also be comfortable presenting, leading conversations, and giving solid recommendations that can be tested and tracked.
As a Business Analyst, you will:
Be a key stakeholder in data-driven decision making, product roadmaps and strategic business planning
Leverage data to understand how our users interact with our product - and how they can achieve even greater success
Be responsible to constantly monitor our business results and provide your insights in real time, to help us achieve our goals
Identify possible gaps in our business and product, and initiate projects that will help us meet our KPIs
Plan and perform a wide range of tests, and help gain useful recommendations based on their analysis
Provide your recommendations and insights directly to our management team
Work closely and directly with multiple functions within Wix, such as product managers, engineering teams, finance, and customer care
Improve access and visibility to our data by data visualizations - using various BI tools (internal and external)
Read more about our role in this article: What it Means to Be a Data-Driven Company

We are:
The Marketing Data Group - a group of Data Analysts and Engineers transforming data from millions of users who interact with Wix every day, into valuable and actionable business insights.
Data plays a major role in our world-class marketing activities, and we use cutting edge technologies to drive improvements in it. We’re focused on guiding decisions in key areas of Wix growth activities, by measuring and optimizing new channels, user journeys and marketing initiatives.
We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help us shape our strategy and drive our user's success.
You are:
A highly analytical person with exceptional attention to detail. You need to be an expert in leveraging data into business insights and decisions and managing the entire data life cycle of defining infrastructure, modeling, analysis, visualization and communication.
You are also curious,  independent and have excellent problem solving skills and you thrive in a fast-paced field where data, product and marketing meet.
Experience in quantitative analysis (preferably for an Internet company) or working in an online environment, and with SQL and data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI  - are an advantage.
As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will:
Leverage all the information we gather from different sources to help make data-driven decisions that’ll build our strategy and drive brand recognition, growth and engagement
Develop and run quantitative analysis and reports while working with enormous amounts of data, in order to give actionable business insights
Be the data and analytical lead onprojects across the group, partnering with the different teams to define, execute, measure and optimize our core business models
Plan, execute and analyze a wide range of tests in order to improve how we engage with our users
Promote awareness and understanding of our key metrics by developing automated tools and visualizations

We are:
The Marketing Data Team - a group of data analysts and engineers transforming data from millions of users who interact with Wix every day into valuable and actionable business insights. Data plays a major role in our world-class marketing activities, and we use cutting edge technologies to drive improvements in it, every step of the way. We’re focused on guiding decisions in key areas of Wix growth activities, by measuring and optimizing new channels, user journeys and marketing initiatives. We love using data to find solutions to complicated questions that help drive Wix’s long-term growth.
We’re looking for a Data Analytics Lead to join our team, and influence and drive our marketing strategy and success.
You are:
Vastly experienced (4+ years) with very large data sets and quantitative analysis, preferably for a web or mobile company. You’re an expert in SQL and have strong analytical skills, excellent attention to detail, and the ability to draw meaningful insights from large amounts of data.
You take a problem-solving approach to everything and know how to put your business judgment and strategic thinking to work in a fast-paced field, thriving in the place where data, product and marketing meet. Plus, you’re an excellent communicator with great time management skills, and a passion for analytics and data.
As a Data Analytics Lead, you will:
Mentor and provide guidance to Data & Business Analysts in the different marketing and business teams
Drive new initiatives to elevate the professional level and quality of data solutions and products
Help drive a culture of measurement, learning and growth amongst our teams
Identify processes, resources and tools that improve productivity, performance and enable deeper, more scalable solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, execute, measure and improve the impact of our marketing efforts.
Recruit and train Data Analysts

The Business Analysts group at Wix. We’re the people who leverage the power of data to make a huge impact on our products and business plans. We partner with all business and product units at Wix - with the goal of transforming data to ideas that can help our users succeed. 
As Business Analysts in a data-driven company, we play a strategic role in shaping business and product decisions. We help planning and prioritizing based on the analysis of impact and potential, and bring clarity and certainty with our models and predictions.

We are:
The Market Intelligence & Research team at Wix. We sit at the intersection of the product, marketing and business units. Our team provides C Level Management with strategic analyses and real-world insights into Wix’s customers, competitors, markets and products.
We’re looking for an experienced Senior Product Researcher who loves technology, strategy & data and is ultimately excellent at finding creative answers to complex questions.
You are:
A creative problem solver with at least 4 years’ relevant work experience as a user or product researcher, analyst within a global tech company, consulting or market research firm. You have experience analyzing and researching products & user journey, as well as a deep understanding of the B2B & B2C SaaS ecosystem. You have owned projects end-to-end, have an understanding of both quantitative and qualitative research methods, strong analytical skills and ultimately can convey those insights to a wide range of stakeholders in the most engaging and actionable manner.
Bonus points if you have a background in Data Science, have worked with 3rd party APIs and have a Masters or PhD in Human-Computer Interaction, Sociology, Psychology, Information Science, Computer Science (or similar), or equivalent.
As part of the Market Intelligence & Strategy team you will:
Own all strategic consulting and research for a specific domain / market / category.
Research, analyze and report on the landscape including trends, product lines, pricing / business models, and methods of operation.
Execute custom research, due diligence, strategic analysis and recommendation  by leveraging 1st and 3rd party sources.
Gather and prioritize key questions from management as well as product, design, engineering and marketing teams
Analyze qualitative and quantitative results and convey those insights to the appropriate people in the most engaging and actionable manner.
Translate research data and findings into actionable / strategic insights using strong storytelling, data visualization, and presentation skills.

We are:
A top-notch data-driven company. We’re growing so fast (180M users) that we’re collecting more data than we can monetize. Our Data Science group consists of ~50 people, of which there are 20+ data scientists, and others (engineering, curation and labeling) that help us make our projects successful and impactful for Wix. We apply SOTA Machine Learning techniques to Wix’s data to improve the product, internal processes and personalization for users, which in turn improves our profitability. And that’s where you come in.

We’re looking for a talented data genius to work in our amazing company. It's well known that we have a unique atmosphere at Wix and people really like to work here, probably because the company's culture is employee-first (after the user of course) :)
You are:
Kind of a unicorn, that is, an End-to-End Data Scientist. For us, this means you’re a data guy (or gal) with data x-ray eyes. A researcher at heart, you love the fraud & compliance domain, and have at least 5 years’ financial industry experience in a risk-related discipline. You also have extensive knowledge of the eCommerce fraud field and cyber-crime ecosystem.  
You're proficient in SQL and have experience in slice and dice big data. You’re a scientist who can speak and sketch about conditional probabilities, entropies & embeddings as if it was your mother tongue. Although you can't think in more than 3 dimensions, we expect you to know the math of high dimensions, where our data resides.

A Machine Learning practitioner, your arsenal is full of sharp ML tools. You deeply understand classical ML & DL algs for the whole spectrum of problems and domains: Computer Vision, NLP, Recommendation Systems, Supervised & Unsupervised Learning. You'll need them all! A business mind who can speak the business language, you know how to work across all levels and areas of the company with various stakeholders. You’re an impressive communicator at all levels. You’re proficient / fluent with Python machine learning tools and SQL, and you’re a programmer who’s experienced in coding your algorithms into production (pref in Python). 
It goes without saying that you’re an awesome human being, the kind of person we want to hang out with in the pub at night (and we do).
As a Data Scientist, you will:
Build data driven tools to automate optimize velocity and scale risk decision points include, fraud detection and payment behavior. 
Aggregate known risk (connecting the dots), be forward looking and externally aware, challenge known risks, illuminate unknown risks and ensure you actively handle and reduce legacy risk while improving business & fraud KPIs.
Find the needle in our Big Data haystack! We seriously have tons of it - we know this is the kind of hype you’ll hear from a lot of companies, but we’ve got the data to back it up. We collect endless amounts of data every second... waiting for you to crunch them into actionable insights.
Get to work on extremely diverse problems and domains.
Create an impact by applying Machine Learning techniques and models to Wix’s enormous piles of data.
Directly influence the way Wix does business by leading research projects and eventually implement them in production within the Wix ecosystem.
Work collaboratively with other team members.
Strive to learn new stuff and lead us to continue being a state-of-the-art group. 
Take the time needed to grow professionally. Once in a while you'll step out of your box and work on other different problems - whatever you choose!

We are:
The Market Intelligence & Research team at Wix. We sit at the intersection of the product, marketing and business units. Our team provides C Level Management with strategic analyses and real-world insights into Wix’s customers, competitors, markets and products.
We’re looking for an experienced senior analyst/researcher who loves technology, strategy & data and is ultimately excellent at finding creative answers to complex questions.
You are:
A creative problem solver with at least 4 years of relevant work experience working as a researcher, analyst and/or strategic consultant within a global tech company, consulting or market research firm. You have experience analyzing and researching markets, products, or companies using 1st & 3rd party data sources, performing data visualization e.g., building custom dashboards, automating custom reports and delivering recommendations based on your work. You have previously led research end to end, have an understanding of both quantitative and qualitative research and deep understanding of corp dev, product, user journey, marketing and/or market analysis.
Bonus points if you have a background in data science, have worked with 3rd party APIs and have a BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, economics or engineering; and if you know SQL, Python, R or any other scripting language.
As part of the Market Intelligence & Strategy team you will:
Own all strategic consulting and research for a specific domain/market /category.
Research, analyze and report on the landscape including trends, product lines, pricing/business models, and methods of operation.
Execute custom research, due diligence, strategic analysis and recommendation by leveraging 1st and 3rd party sources.
Have a deep understanding of channel strategies/marketing mix, brand measurement/health/tracking, and user journey across products in the B2C & B2B SaaS ecosystem.
Develop and run quantitative analysis & build reports/dashboards to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding about key developments, determinants and dynamics within the market.
Translate research data and findings into actionable/strategic insights using strong storytelling, data visualization, and presentation skills.

We are:
Wix’s Marketing Data Team - a group of Data Analysts and engineers transforming data from millions of users who interact with Wix every day into valuable and actionable business insights. Data plays a major role in our world-class marketing activities, and we use cutting-edge technologies to improve it. We’re focused on guiding decisions in key areas of Wix growth activities, by measuring and optimizing new channels, user journeys and marketing initiatives. We love using data to find solutions to complicated problems and help drive Wix’s long-term growth.
We’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team, and influence and drive our marketing strategy and success.
You are:
A BSc/BA student in a quantitative field with one or two years left to complete your degree. You’re business-oriented and have an analytical approach to everything you do with a lot of passion for data. You’re available to work half-time (~22 hours/week).
As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will:
Partner with different marketing teams to design, execute, measure and improve the impact of our marketing efforts
Analyze and process tons of data, and use it to give actionable insights to the business, with the end goal of driving brand recognition, growth and engagement
Develop and run quantitative analysis, reports, and more with the end goal of supporting our marketing efforts
Produce automated tools and dashboards to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key metrics and experiment results
Be the data and analytical lead on all types of projects, while working closely with teams throughout the marketing department
Optimize the core business model of Wix

We are:
Wix Marketing team - we're passionate professionals who create some of the world's biggest marketing campaigns, grow our vibrant social media channels, and launch innovative Wix products. With our international TV, radio and online ads, we let the world know what Wix is all about.
  You are:
An excellent communicator with hands-on experience in operations and management, as well as leadership foundations. You feel comfortable to dive into any area of the business, to understand its needs, and to facilitate operational decisions. You have proven ability to track, prioritize, and drive multiple concurrent projects to success. You’re able to work well with executives, and to lead and influence others across multiple levels and multiple functions of the organization.
  You’re also a problem solver who’s passionate about efficiency and understands both the big picture, and the value of details. You have a proven track record of working with very large teams at an extremely fast pace. As an even-tempered team player with conflict resolution skills, you enjoy creating order and using these skills to manage complex and large scale projects in a matrix structure.
  Good written and verbal communication skills are a must, since this role it’s highly interactive and cross-functional. You love technology and you know how to operate internal systems and help find technical solutions for various  issues.
  As a Head of Operations at the Marketing team, you will:
Manage the Operations team and work closely with the heads of the Marketing teams and with our department’s management
Help build a successful, happy and strong Marketing department: design optimal workflows, align internal processes and get things done
Create a working plan for your team and help its members become top professionals
Coordinate internal resources for flawless execution of projects
Ensure projects are delivered on time and within scope
Assist in defining the project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
Develop detailed project plans to monitor and track progress
Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions that enable the marketing team to work efficiently
Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices across marketing activities
Provide recommendations that enhance future campaign performance and measurements
Enable the implementation of strategic efforts by coordinating marketing efforts within the department and across the company

We are:
Wix’s Marketing Languages team. We’re extremely passionate about writing and the way words shape our brand. We create engaging and interesting on-brand emails, landing pages, blog articles, social posts, scripts, banners, campaigns and more.
Our mission is to provide the most comprehensive and creative content, bring organic traffic to our pages and convert readers into users.
You are:
A native Italian speaker who loves writing. You have professional writing experience and can quickly write clear, meaningful content for marketing purposes and blogs. You understand the language we’ve created at Wix and you can seamlessly use it to write landing pages, blog articles, emails and scripts.
You’re able to produce and edit state-of-the-art content about any topic, based on any given brief. You have a good understanding of the importance of SEO and you have a passion for researching tools to implement an optimal and efficient content strategy. You’re not afraid of experimenting and you interpret data in order to continuously improve your work.
You’re a team player, an amazing listener and an independent thinker. You work best under tight deadlines and you take constructive feedback well.
As an Italian Marketing Manager you will:
Write creative, clear content for emails, landing pages, blog articles, social posts, video scripts and online or offline campaigns
Learn how to analyze data and use tools to optimize your written content
Apply the Wix tone and voice across all materials for Italian speakers
Collaborate with different Marketing teams to initiate and manage new projects from conception to execution
Understand the user’s perspective and apply it to your content
Deliver under tight deadlines and with minimal revisions

JobTitle: Japanese - Marketing Blogger and Content Writer
JobRequirements:

Wix’s Marketing Languages team. We’re extremely passionate about writing and the way words shape our brand. We are:
The Wix Marketing copywriting team. We create essential content for every aspect of the user journey. Each landing page, email, app name and campaign is crafted with love and respect for a discerning audience who wants to succeed online. Our informative, helpful, fun and lively content guides our users every step of the way and is absolutely essential to the Wix user experience.
We're looking for an exceptional editor to elevate and inspire the copywriting coming from our 25 person team. The know-how, ease, confidence and joy our copy projects, is core to our business. The creative leader we're looking for has an uncompromising eye and will catapult the quality of our work and its impact.
You are:
An experienced editor/copywriter with a proven track record in managing a creative team at a leading tech company or an agency with top-tier clients.
You’re able to write, edit, and ideate with a large creative team responsible for creating user journeys. You distill technical information easily, and know how to make it accessible and fun to absorb.
As a skilled writer and editor, you understand the user intent behind each product launch and can create content that captivates the right audience to engage and convert. You know how to motivate a team of creatives and help make their work better while building their confidence and autonomy.
As the Lead Copywriting Editor you will:
Improve the creativity, clarity and execution of our copy, in the form of landing pages, emails, app names, campaigns and events
Creatively manage a team of 8 editors and 16 writers who work across all Wix products
Work to evolve the tone of voice of the Wix brand
Own the marketing style guide and its iterative development across all brands
Oversee talent recruitment for the team
Work on new product launches with the Head of Content to elevate the quality of our writing and storytelling across all our marketing materials

We are:
Wix’s Email Marketing team. We manage all email communications sent by Wix to our 200M users in 190 countries. We operate in 19 languages and send ~60M messages a month. We’re the company's largest communication channel when it comes to our users and plays a crucial part in the success of our marketing efforts.
Our team functions in a fast-paced environment, continually working to meet business goals, develop email funnels for our verticals, optimize sales and promotions and increase brand awareness. Running cutting edge tests is part of our DNA and we’re always searching for new ideas. This is an opportunity to thrive both professionally and personally in a dynamic and creative environment.
You are:
A skilled email marketer with a good understanding of email metrics, deliverability, and HTML. The user and their journey are always on your mind and you execute projects accordingly. You have an eye for detail—if a pixel isn’t in its place you’ll be the one to catch it! You approach projects with analytical thought and out-of-the-box solutions, drawing on data and pivot tables to optimize your work. This role is made for a team player with excellent interpersonal skills who is committed to bringing their ideas to life.
Bonus points if you have experience in website building (hardcoded), familiarity with Oracle Responsys, SQL knowledge, and experience coding JS.
As a Marketing Automation Specialist, you will:
Plan and produce automated email funnels, using code and basic HTML, to improve brand recognition, conversion rates, and retention.
Collaborate closely with other teams on the marketing campaign creation process.
Analyze, monitor and optimize key factors like open & click rates, delivery to inbox, unsubscribe and complaint rates in emails, using Tableau and pivot tables.
Plan and execute email personalization, dynamic content and segmentation.
Execute planned and ad-hoc promotions.
Research and explore new industry updates and ideas.

We are:
Wix’s Marketing team - we're passionate professionals who create some of the world's biggest marketing campaigns, grow our vibrant social media channels, and launch innovative products. With our international TV, radio and online ads, we let the world know what Wix is all about.
You are:
A serious web user who understands Wix’s different audiences and their changing needs and can establish a direct connection to them.
You have a deep business understanding along with excellent research and analytical skills that you can maximize through your knowledge of the relevant tools. 
You’re a great writer in English and you’re a natural storyteller. You have a lot of experience in creating business and content presentations, and you’re also an independent self starter with initiative and curiosity.
You have excellent people skills and you know how to motivate them to corporate with you. You’re also a great project manager who knows how to make things happen. 
As a Marketing Business Assistant you will:
Work directly with our CMO and help articulate the ideas, strategic vision, business and professional know-hows into words and visual presentations 
Learn and assimilate Wix’s Marketing team’s way of thinking and working, and express it in writing 
Write content that will improve the group’s professionalism
Keep a close eye on all our marketing activities, initiate researching efforts on various subjects and help improve our creativity, our innovation and our connection to our users
Constantly review our content and always strive to improve it
Initiate projects and work independently to achieve them while motivating and leading different stakeholders within Wix
Follow current trends on the web and recognize opportunities when they arise
Create and foster relationships with our users in order to understand their needs and the best ways to connect with them

We are:
Wix’s Creative Acquisition team. We’re masters in the art of converting people into active users and advocates of our awesome product. Our team initiates and manages creative materials for online campaigns on various paid media channels, like Facebook, YouTube, Google Search and more. We continually explore new ideas to stay ahead of industry trends and attract today’s digital audience.
You are:
An experienced and passionate online marketer with at least two years’ experience in an online creative role. You have a deep knowledge of web interfaces and internet culture, and use terms like CTR, CPC, CPM and CPP in everyday conversation! You’re an outside-the-box thinker, an innovative problem solver with a keen eye for guiding the creative process to produce online advertising/campaigns that break new boundaries.

You have a strong portfolio that shows experience in brand and in web design and you’re looking for a full-time job (not freelance).
As a Web Designer, you will:
Design, work on and manage large-scale, high-end design projects and campaigns that reach millions of users every day
Take ownership of each project from the first ink drop to the last pixel
Develop innovative branding concepts
Unite all aspects of our products’ presence with a consistent look & feel
Collaborate with different teams across the company, including Product, Content visual experts, Marketing and QA to work on inspirational projects that get global exposure
Create beautiful design assets while always staying true to our brand identity
Multitask on several projects at a time, and under pressure
Please include your updated portfolio when you send your CV

JobTitle: Customer Care Call Center Expert- Shift Position
JobRequirements:
We are:
Wix’s Customer Care Team in Tel Aviv! At Wix, we build products that help millions of users grow their businesses online, and we care a lot about their experience. As part of our global organization of Customer Care, our team is responsible for building strong relationships with Wix users, uncovering their needs and guiding them to success throughout their user journey.
At our office, you’ll find a friendly atmosphere, fantastic coworkers and diverse opportunities for growth in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You will also find many perks, such as exercise classes and wellness activities, professional workshops, and lots other fun activities!
During these times, we keep the Wix vibe while working from home.
You are:
A native Hebrew speaker (fluent in English) professional with 1+ years’ experience in Call Center customer service, in tech or similar industries. You also have experience with providing support for the Israeli Market.
You are interested in working in shifts in a dynamic and flexible schedule.
You find meaning and pleasure in helping others succeed, enjoy building personal relationships and are curious to know what really drives users and their needs. You have strong critical thinking skills and are confident about taking responsibility and ownership. You hold yourself to high performance standards and work to improve constantly. You’re passionate about new technologies and always eager to learn more. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and look at change as an opportunity to grow.
Lastly, you realize there is more than one career ladder, and you have the drive to find your own career path - recognizing your strengths and interests.
As a Call Center Customer Care Expert, you will:
Build strong relationships with Wix users, uncover their needs and help guide them through their user journey.
Offer them new options and alternatives where appropriate.
Develop expertise in Wix products and stay up to date with new features and improvements.
Work with other departments and product teams, and liaise with them about our users’ needs to impact product roadmaps based on user voice.
Analyze user behavior and relevance to determine their effect on user satisfaction.
Manage email, phone, chat and/or other communication channels as primary contact for Wix
Work schedule includes morning, evening and nights, 5 shifts a week (Sunday-Friday)

We are:
Wix’s Customer Care Team in Tel Aviv. We’re currently undergoing massive growth as part of our effort to support our ever-growing global user base. At Wix, we build products that help millions of users grow their businesses online, and we care about their experience. As part of our global Customer Care organization, our team is responsible for building strong relationships with Wix users, uncovering their needs, and guiding them to success throughout their user journey.
At our office, you’ll find a friendly atmosphere, fantastic coworkers and diverse opportunities for growth in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You’ll also find many perks, such as exercise classes and wellness activities, professional workshops, and lots other fun activities. 
You are:
A professional with 1+ years’ experience in Customer Service, in tech or similar industries. You are also a native French speaker, proficient in communicating both in writing and verbally. You find meaning and pleasure in helping others succeed, enjoy building personal relationships and are curious to know what really drives users and their needs. You have strong critical thinking skills and are confident about taking responsibility and ownership. You hold yourself to high performance standards and work to improve constantly.
You’re eager to explore new technologies, and can learn new concepts and solve problems thoughtfully and effectively. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and look at change as an opportunity to grow. You also realize there is more than one career ladder, and have the drive to find your own career path - recognizing your strengths and interests.
As a Customer Care Expert, you will:
Build strong connections with Wix users, uncover their needs and help guide them through their user journey, offering them new options and alternatives where appropriate.
Communicate with Wix users on a daily basis, mainly using written channels such as tickets and chat.
Develop expertise in Wix products and stay up to date on new features and improvements.
Represent the user voice within the company and participate in projects to analyze user behavior.
Influence the way we provide training to improve Experts’ product knowledge.
Work to improve the quality of our support by identifying knowledge gaps and problematic flows.
Work closely with other professional teams within the department such as quality control, advanced technical support, knowledge base, learning & development, as well as our product support teams with the shared mission of providing the greatest care for our users.
Please send your CV in English.

We are:
Wix’s Customer Care department. We’re a group of experts who use our unique understanding of Wix products to provide support and inspiration to over 200 million users around the world. We’re responsible for collecting valuable user feedback to improve Wix’s products, and play a vital part in moving the company forward.
You are:
A talented problem solver who can write and speak fluent English. You have at least 1 year of experience in Technical Support and knowledge of JavaScript/HTML/CSS and HTTP Protocol. You’re internet savvy, with a solid knowledge of the software development lifecycle and client-server architecture.
You thrive in a fast-paced work environment and love using strong critical thinking skills to thoughtfully identify challenges and solutions. You’re also a self-learner who is independent but also a great team player.
As Customer Care Technical Support, you will:
Provide Wix users with technical solutions.
Investigate complex issues and fix them, using a variety of technologies and tools.
Work closely with developers/product to prioritize issues.
Influence the way we support our users and improve it to make sure our users’ experience is the best possible.
Work closely with product and R&D on features and processes.

We are:
Wix’s Customer Care Global Learning & Development team. Our mission is to establish scalable learning & development programs that empower our Customer Care Experts to be successful, master their craft and become lifelong learners.
You are:
Someone highly professional who’s truly enthusiastic about learning and has a passion for soft skills. You have experience working with adult learners and you're committed to producing engaging learning solutions for our Customer Care & Partners group employees that support their success through behavioral change. You have experience working in fields such as instructional design, training, education, or communications. You're adaptable and have proven success in a fast paced environment. Ideally you have work experience that required you to collaborate globally.
You’re eager to support the growth of the soft skills team, you have the ability to solve problems thoughtfully and effectively, and you can take initiative into researching new topics. You're a self-starter and you enjoy working both independently and collaboratively.  You have excellent interpersonal skills and you can demonstrate strengths in presenting and public speaking. You also need to have excellent English - written and spoken. Experience working with Customer Care/Support teams - a big plus! Occasional global travel may be required when travel restrictions are eased.
As a Skills Development Specialist, you will:
Work as part of the soft skills team within the Customer Care group at Wix
Develop content for new skills training sessions. This includes research, writing scripts for training videos, and creating presentations for live workshops
Facilitate engaging and progressive soft skills training sessions globally
Adjust delivery method and content of training sessions based on cultural expectations of the audience to best support learning
Update existing soft skills training material when needed
Assist in scheduling soft skills training sessions. Partner with appropriate site L&D specialists to confirm timing and audience details
Maintain a library of examples to use during training sessions to ensure topics are practical and job related
Create new interactive components that reinforce soft skills concepts during and after training sessions
Research soft skills topics to ensure our department is on top of industry trends

We are:
The Editor X team: two cutting edge web creation platforms. ADI is a technology platform that combines website design and content creation with artificial intelligence to create a complete website in minutes. We’ve written over two million words that our users use when building stunning websites–and we’re not done. Editor X, our  brand new, sophisticated web creation platform: driven by, and built for, professional creators. We’re still in Beta phase so when you join the team you’ll participate in our unique content creation process.
We’re looking for a native English-speaking writer to help us create content that will impact millions of Wix users and help them to express and promote their business.
You are:
A native English speaker with at least 3 years’ professional internet writing experience such as blogging, writing marketing content, technical or product writing, media, advertising agency, etc. You have the flexibility to handle multiple projects and changing priorities, you’re deadline driven and very organized. You are familiar with project management tools and have a basic understanding of data analytics.
Bonus points if you have a Bachelor's degree in English literature, communication, journalism, marketing, creative writing or a related field.
As a Wix ADI/Editor X Writer, you will:
Create clear, well-written copy for websites and website templates.
Conduct thorough research to define essential messaging for a variety of business types in a wide array of industries.
Take ownership of the entire content creation process end-to-end, including some of the more technical aspects of our product.
Understand how to apply the essence of the Wix language.
Collaborate with other internal stakeholders.
Ensure accurate information on all projects.
Deliver under tight deadlines with minimal revisions.

We are:
The Wix Knowledge Base - a group of writers producing support content for our over 200 million users around the world. Divided into teams that specialize in specific Wix products, we break down complicated concepts and troubleshooting flows into concise, accessible and helpful text.

You are:

You are a native level English speaker with excellent writing abilities, well versed in the world of online digital products and the user journey. You thrive in a fast-paced, data-driven work environment and can juggle multiple projects at once, while maintaining ownership of these projects from start to finish.
You’re a skilled Team Lead with 1-3 years of experience, a leader who can create a vision for your team and lead people through it’s execution. Your excellent communication skills make it easy for you to connect and inspire both your team and colleagues. You also have experience working in a global team. You’re intelligent and unafraid to share your opinions when appropriate–but you’re also humble and respectful of the opinions of others.

As an English Knowledge Base Team Lead, you will:
Produce well-written content for the Wix Knowledge Base, including how-to articles, walkthroughs, feature requests, and documentation of known issues.
Lead, advise and mentor a team of 2-5 writers in producing top-notch content.
Work as a partner with the other Team Leads in the group through collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Collaborate with a broad forum of experts and stakeholders, including Product Support Experts and Product Managers, to create high quality deliverables.
See the big picture and understand the user journey, while navigating our matrix system, helping your team to prioritize often conflicting tasks and projects.
Make data-driven decisions to improve and optimize content, and influence the way we support our users to make sure they have the best possible experience.
Assist in defining standards and content strategies for the group.
Work closely with the Knowledge Base editors and group manager to align on team projects and growth.

We are:
The Product Localization Team. We use clear, eye-level copy to shape the way people experience and interact with our products. Guided by the Wix tone and voice, we craft compelling copy that gets the right message across every time. We collaborate closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders across the company to create amazing products. Along with localizing text, we make sure that Wix’s products are adjusted to specific locales and markets, providing our users worldwide with a stunning, local experience.
You are:
A native French speaker with 3 years professional writing experience, including technical or product writing, media, advertising agency, or marketing. You have the flexibility to handle multiple projects and changing priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment. You’re a great team player with a positive attitude and strong leadership skills, and you have excellent spoken and written English.
As a French UX Writer, you will:
Write clear, creative copy in the Wix tone and voice.
Understand how to apply the essence of the Wix language.
Collaborate with other product managers, developers, and other stakeholders across the company internal stakeholders.
Ensure the user experience is excellent and best in class.
Juggle multiple projects at once, while prioritizing your tasks and meeting tight deadlines.
Check that all text achieves Wix's communication objectives and brand alignment.

Learn how to understand the user’s perspective and intent and apply it to your content.

We are:
The Writers’ Guild at Wix - we’re a group of 150+ amazing content creators from all over the world who are passionate about the written word. We work on all types of text from marketing and UX to knowledge base and internal communications. Our common belief? Words matter! We work in a fast-paced, exciting environment where things are always changing and there’s never a dull moment. Join us to be involved in shaping the way our text impacts everyone who reads it.
You are:
An excellent native English writer with great interpersonal skills and amazing creative ideas. You’re a storyteller at heart, someone who’s passionate about creating great content and who understands the importance of content hierarchy, clear messaging and the power of words.
Your writing experience, teamwork and communication skills make it easy for you to talk to and work with anyone, from writers & designers to product managers & broadcasters. You’re also an amazing listener, fun to work with, an independent thinker and you work well with superiors. You love learning new things and can quickly shift from project to project with ease.
Big advantage if you have experience in any or all of the following:
Marketing Writing/Copywriting
UX Writing/Content Strategy
Help Center Writing/Management
PR/Internal Communications
Blog Writing

As a Senior Content Writer you will:
Be dispatched to teams within Wix to assist with writing for UX, marketing, knowledgebase, internal comms and more.
Create/Revise/Proofread content as needed.
Curate content created by others, ensuring it is structured correctly, written clearly and is in the Wix voice and tone.
Research and share articles, ideas, and interesting tidbits of information with other writers.
Contribute to executing the Writers’ Guild strategy as needed, and as directed by Guild management.
Be in charge of creating content for ad hoc projects like internal websites, event invitations, newsletters, job descriptions and more, as the need arises.

You can quickly write clear, meaningful content in a relatable, conversational tone of voice.

Be a total professional in your collaborations with Product Marketing Managers, Designers, Broadcasts and many other teams within the company.

Write copy that meets Wix’s brand goals and objectives, edit yourself and be able to give critical, meaningful criticism to your teammates.
Manage multiple projects at once and adjust content according to feedback.

A team player who can give and take feedback constructively, you’re self-motivated and exceptional at task management. You love a good challenge (or 3)!
