We are:
The Wix HR team - a group of creative, proactive people who take time to listen, explore and analyze while leaving room for intuition when making decisions. We do HR in the Wix way – meaning we make sure to have fun as part of our work and take nothing for granted. We collaborate with Wix’s employees and managers, as well as our HR peers, to play a key role in maintaining our unique workplace vibe while continuing to grow and develop the company.
You are:
Passionate about people with great interpersonal skills. You’re an outside-the-box thinker who stays on top of industry best practices. You have an analytical mind and experience analyzing compensation processes. You’re also knowledgeable in Excel (from advanced data analysis to manipulation), with a deep understanding of employee compensation and benefits.
You’re highly organized with the ability to multitask and prioritize varied complex projects, and you have experience working in the world of compensation and benefits (2-5 years). You also have some experience working in a fast-paced, international company. Note: English and Hebrew fluency is a must.
As a Compensation & Benefits Expert, you will:
Manage company-wide C&B plans (inclusive of health insurance, pension and development of internal ranges).
Research and analyze internal/external data relating to C&B elements (including market trends and benchmarks) and match them to our company culture.
Expertly structure offers for all new hires - across diverse company roles.
Maintain the compensation process (including gathering data, analytics, etc.) and serve as an active advisor and support for HR and managers.
Work closely with HR, managers and the Legal & Finance teams.
Participate and analyze results from global salary surveys.
Daily maintenance of C&B reports and elements.

We are:
Wix’s People team, a group of creative and proactive people who take time to listen, explore and analyze while leaving room for intuition when making decisions. We do HR the Wix way, making sure to have fun as part of work and take nothing for granted. The Learning & Organizational Development team at Wix plays a critical role in ensuring Wix has the tools, platforms and the right learning opportunities to multiply its impact and foster exceptional individuals and teams. We do that by creating a unique journey of professional and personal growth for our managers and employees.
You are:
An experienced OD professional, with 10+ years of experience in a high-tech or similar fast-paced environment, leading global learning & organizational development initiatives.
Passionate about all aspects of learning & organizational development
UsIng your creativity and experience to build unique, tailor-made development programs, using multiple tools and methods
Familiar with the “classic” methodologies, constantly challenging them, and coming up with new ideas and implementation practices
Holding substantial experience and strong knowledge of modern learning & development program design, as well as execution and implementation practices
Able to see and think beyond traditional learning experiences, and develop innovative  learning & development
Thriving in a disruptive environment
Able to work through, and see the full context, but also adjust and personalize your work to teams and individuals
Comfortable delivering and facilitating learning sessions for various populations
A quick learner, a go getter who always keeps an open mind and willingness to be challenged
As a Global Learning and Organizational Development Partner, you will:
Lead E2E global, complex and strategic learning & development projects with different partners within Wix and outside of it, according to business focuses and best practices
Build relationships and provide learning & development consulting to multiple stakeholders at all organizational levels
Design E2E leadership & talent initiatives, partnering with senior managers and HR business partners
Create personalized, tailor-made programs for specific needs of teams and managers
Choose and implement platforms & systems to enable effective and fluent L&D activities and measurements
Raise the bar on our learning & personal growth experience, by measuring impact, seek employee and manager voice to determine areas for improvement
Be a part of a global L&D team
Work and collaborate with local and international vendors & trainers
Deliver and facilitate group learning sessions

We are:
Wix’s HR team, a group of creative and proactive people who take time to listen, explore and analyze while leaving room for intuition when making decisions. We do HR the Wix way, meaning we make sure to have fun as part of work and take nothing for granted. Wix HR collaborates with Wix’s employees and managers, as well as our HR peers, to play a key role in maintaining our unique workplace vibe while continuing to grow and develop the company.
We’re looking for an HR expert to join our growing team and take part in the ongoing effort to grow the company while keeping its unique culture and vibe.
You are:
An HR Expert with a passion for people and a deep sense of sensitivity. You’re creative and always keep an open mind. You have 3-5 years of HR experience in a high-tech environment, and know how to execute projects in a timely manner and multitask on different initiatives. You also have great interpersonal skills and the ability to consult with employees to get them through various situations.
As an HR Expert, you will:
Provide HR support to Wix employees & managers.
Take an active part in maintaining the unique culture and guiding Wix employees in it.
Demonstrate problem solving and decision making skills with understanding of employee relations.
Take an active part in growing the company by different recruitment initiatives.
Multi-task on various projects and initiatives.

We are:
The Wix HR team. We partner with managers to attract the best talent and drive business decisions. We know that building a winning team comes down to the people. Hear Shelly, our Chief People Officer, talk about what we do: https://bit.ly/2K8zSB7 
You are:
A recruitment professional with 5+ years’ experience. You know how to lead in-house recruitment efforts for companies in the hi tech industry and are an expert in conducting in-depth face to face interviews You have a clear, data-based, well-established voice when it comes to hiring talent - and you love what you do.
You are all about relationships; you get that this is where it all happens. You’re business-oriented, data driven, interested in the world of technology and have a sense of urgency. You’re creative, independent, and you own what you do. 
As Senior Talent Acquisition Business Partner, you will:
Play a major role in achieving the company’s growth goals.
Advise and partner closely with hiring managers. 
Be responsible for assessment processes, including conducting face to face interviews.
Own your data, and use it to build your strategy.
Develop innovative and engaging candidate sourcing strategies to recruit the best talent.
Manage the full recruitment process for multiple roles, from interviews to the feedback stage.
Create a unique and memorable experience for candidates.
Be an ambassador for our culture and mission.

We are:
A global team of creative, proactive and innovative people, passionate about continuously improving our employees’ experience. We do wellbeing the Wix way - always staying connected to the business goals, personalized and focused on employees’ needs. Plus, one of our core values is fun!
We’re looking for a Wellbeing Expert who will play an integral part in creating a great workplace experience, emphasized by Wix’s culture.
You are:
A people-oriented professional with excellent interpersonal skills, who’s passionate about designing wellbeing solutions. You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments since you’re curious by nature and love exploring new ways of thinking and doing things. You’re also a creative thinker, and your operational skills are at the highest level: deadline oriented, multi-tasker and a get-things-done attitude.
You have at least 2 years of experience in creating large scale events and initiatives in a similar role.
As a Wellbeing Expert, you will:
Develop innovative, trendy new events that match our fast paced work environment.
Organize every aspect of the company's parties, holiday, toasts, lectures and other fun events.
Partner up with team leaders in order to build their teams’ wellbeing holistic plan & consult on employee experience issues.
Take care of employees’ general wellbeing, which includes welcoming new employees, life cycle gifts and recognitions.
Collaborate with both internal and external teams for the best possible outcomes.
Analyze relevant data and use it to make strategic decisions and improvements.

We are:
The Wix In House Agency - an internal design and development agency and the only team at Wix that creates websites from A-Z for our strategic partners - enterprises, institutions and influencers. We build dream projects on Wix’s most advanced platforms like Editor X and Wix Velo while continuously pushing our platforms’ limits. We’re advisors, visionaries, creators, and techies. We believe in working together with different teams and products within Wix and we’re always aiming for that sweet spot between cool and functional. We don’t believe in boundaries and we have no limits when it comes to finding the best technical and product-related solutions for our clients.
You are:
A web savvy client-facing project manager, full of passion for product oriented projects and with a deep understanding of web technology, design, structure and content. You know your way around SEO, DNS management, QA processes and have basic understanding of use of code. You’re flexible, thorough, highly attentive to details, cross-functional and you love the thought of working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You’re service oriented and experienced in managing clients and internal stakeholders, meeting deadlines and leading projects to success. You’re fully fluent in English (native level) and have experience working with the American market.
As an In-house Agency Project Manager, you will:
Take a hands-on management approach to leading the full cycle website creation process from the kick off meeting to final delivery
Interview clients to fully understand the project scope and needs and translate it to a website creation brief and a work plan
Be responsible for task and priority management, and a problem solver for all stakeholders
Develop and manage successful and useful interfaces across the company and elevate those connections into a supportive and problem solving environment
Manage high profile clients by building and maintaining great relationships and taking ownership of client experience
Be the expert for Wix products and features and walk clients through the day to day management of their websites

We are:
The Writers Guild at Wix - the professional organization overseeing all aspects of writing and owning the quality standards of text across Wix. Our 150+ writers across the world are passionate about the written word and produce all types of content from marketing and UX to knowledge base and internal communications. We work in a fast-paced environment where there’s never a dull moment.
We’re looking for an experienced operations manager to coordinate between the various global writing groups, help run cross-guild and cross-company projects, and support the guild with innovative processes and solutions for sensitive, complex operational problems.
You are:
An experienced and delivery-oriented leader with exceptional written and verbal communication skills in English, and at least 3 years’ experience in cross-company project management. You motivate people, set the pace and efficiently implement processes & routines, while maintaining great team spirit and keeping things fun. You are familiar with content management tools and have a basic understanding of data analytics.You’re outstanding at organizing and problem solving, and know how to lead project execution from start to finish.
As a project manager and/or operations manager, you’ve worked with multiple teams across many disciplines & locations in a dynamic and fast-moving high-tech environment. You know what to ask, when to ask it, and who to get the answer from.
Experience in internet content writing and content management, a plus.
As an Writers Guild Operations Manager, you will:
Take a hands-on management approach to leading all internal and external operations of the Writers Guild across our global sites.
Be an essential part of the guild team.
Assist in the recruitment process of writers in Wix, and work closely with senior group managers and HR partners to make sure we recruit the most talented writers.
Assist in managing education programs for product managers in Wix, including onboarding new employees, ongoing professional enrichment through mentorship and workshops.
Help resolve internal technical issues related to internal systems and text production.
Identify gaps and develop company solutions to improve quality and velocity across the guild.
Be the curator of FUN! Plan and implement in-house or off-site activities like team celebrations, happy hours, swags and more.

We are:
The Wix Hub - a team dedicated to developing employee skills and knowledge, as well as helping our customers and partners achieve success with Wix. Our team’s training expertise are part of the onboarding process and ongoing guidance for various types of customers. We love helping business owners, bloggers, community managers and others make their online dreams come true with our platform.
You are:
A Sales Trainer who’s passionate about the online world. You can articulate and speak effectively to various sized audiences, you’re hungry to initiate processes while being driven to improve results, and you’re open to critique.
You’re also experienced in training in both B2B and B2C environments, and you’ve overseen sales training for your organization’s products as well as third party software packages.
You’re a native English speaker with a high level of proficiency in Hebrew. Additional languages are an advantage.
As a Sales Trainer, you will:
Own and execute training for a wide variety of sales teams globally
Build out and lead comprehensive strategy sessions highlighting the best features of the Wix product with a sales-minded focus
Convey and deliver advanced features and content in an easy-to-understand manner within a limited time frame
Consult and lead go-to-market discussions for partners launching the Wix product in their market
Host live feedback sessions and work with our partner sales teams to offer best practices around sales tactics and approaches

We are:
Payments by Wix - a fast-growing group dealing with all aspects of online payment processing and financial services for Wix users. Essentially, we make it possible for millions of Wix users to get paid on their website. We’re a customer obsessed group of experts from all disciplines and we possess vast knowledge and experience in fintech. In addition, one of our main focuses is our in house payment gateway, Wix Payments.
We’re looking for an experienced Senior Operations Manager to join our Payments Operations team. This role is highly cross-functional and will be critical in our efforts to deliver more value to more users, faster.
You are:
A strong, highly organized individual with 8+ years of experience in leading multiple complex programs and/or operations in the web/software industry, with proven experience in the payments industry.
As a Senior Operations Manager, you’ve worked with customer facing teams and with teams across disciplines such as Product Management, Customer Care, Risk and Marketing in multi-location, dynamic and fast-moving high-tech environments. You have great communication and interpersonal skills, you’re a problem-solving star, and you embrace a collaborative working style, while maintaining great team spirit.
You’re a master of turning your vision into a work plan, you’re a leader of execution and delivery and the go-to-person in your team.
As a Senior Operations Manager, you will:
Develop, implement, and monitor day-to-day operational systems and processes that provide visibility into goals, progress, and obstacles for our key initiatives
Help local customer facing teams to assign the right KPIs and to monitor them on a daily basis
Take a hands-on approach to leading a massive part of the Payments operations, empowering and working with different team leaders from various disciplines
Lead our day-to-day activities and ensure that we maintain high quality while constantly improving service for our users and helping them maximize their potential through products and services
Create and own your team’s operational plans, and be the team’s main focal point while working with other groups
Maintain strong and effective internal and external communications between all teams

We are:
The legal team at Wix. As a rapidly growing company, our commercial engagements with worldwide enterprises are growing fast. We deal with complex transactions involving significant legal negotiations, deep product and user-flow understanding and management of processes. Wix’s innovative wide range of services require a high level of legal understanding and flexible thinking.
At Wix we have a fun and young startup vibe, an open-door policy and we deal with interesting and diverse legal challenges on a daily basis. This is not your ordinary attorney position.
We're looking for an experienced commercial transaction lawyer to join our Legal Department. The position requires hands-on performance of legal work, drafting and transaction management in an independent manner in order to support Wix teams globally and lead processes. You’ll be part of the legal team supporting Wix’s B2B business activities which include engagements with business partners, resellers and large enterprises around the globe. As part of our team, you'll play a key role in keeping Wix's legal interests secure and promoting our success.
You are:
A lawyer with 4-6 years of experience working as an in-house counsel of a high-tech company or as a lawyer in a prominent law firm. You should be smart, thorough, diligent, organized, business oriented, and with a passion for learning and researching new legal aspects as they come, without shortcuts.
You must have excellent English (reading, writing and verbal), a substantial experience in drafting top-notch commercial agreements, and an understanding of international law and cross-border commercial transactions and of SaaS and the online environment and products. Your negotiation abilities are high, but we also expect you to be a people person and a team player dedicated to your work and clients.
As a Commercial Transaction Legal Counsel you will:
Be a part of Wix’s Legal B2B Team
Work in a very fast paced and dynamic environment (which means you’re also an amazing multi-tasker)
Be proactive, take responsibility and own projects and transactions from start to finish
Support product development projects, run product reviews and support legal aspects of Wix’s enterprise facing activities
Draft a variety of agreements, terms of use and other legal documents

We are:
The Procurement Team at Wix. We handle all of the company’s procurement needs, liaising with internal stakeholders and external suppliers to close the best commercial deals for Wix. We always strive for efficiency, are expert negotiators, look to achieve optimal results for our company - and have a lot of fun doing it!
You are:
An assertive multitasker with excellent problem-solving skills and flexibility in the face of change. You have a deep understanding of and professional experience with, purchasing contracts, as well as a few years’ purchasing experience in fields like IT, R&D, finance services, consulting, operations, welfare and others.
You have strong verbal and written communication skills, in both Hebrew and English and you are an expert negotiator.
You always keep in mind what good customer service means, and know how to assess what a company needs. You’re great at cooperating with various types of internal customers and can easily work with executives and manage large-scale vendors.
Familiar with an ERP system? That’s a bonus!
As a Procurement Specialist, you will:
· Be responsible for negotiating contracts, improving prices and terms of business with suppliers, and reviewing opportunities to make business savings using negotiation and procurement best practice tools and methods.
· Make sure that Wix gets the best possible offers from its suppliers.
· Be a business partner in understanding different types of company considerations.
· Apply a positive and proactive approach to your work, along with highest-level purchasing methods.
·  Ensure that payments to suppliers are made in accordance with the of contract commercial T&Cs.

We are:
Payments by Wix - a fast-growing group dealing with all aspects of online payment processing and financial services for Wix users. We make it possible for Wix users to get paid on their website. We’re a customer-obsessed group of experts, from all disciplines, with vast knowledge and experience in fintech. Payments by Wix is a high focus company, responsible for processing the income of millions of businesses. In addition, one of our main focuses is our in-house payment gateway, Wix Payments. We use cutting edge technology to ensure that both us, and our merchants, are compliant with laws and regulations throughout the world.
We’re looking for a Head of Underwriting to manage the underwriting group that monitors customer activity and identifies inconsistent behavior. We’re analytical people who enjoy investigating and have a strong problem solving approach. Our primary role is daily monitoring and verification, identifying and investigating inconsistencies regarding existing requirements and providing support to the Customer Care team.
You are:
A leader with 8+ years of  experience in managing, motivating and team building. You’ve worked as a creative Compliance / Underwriting leader for at least 5 years, at least 3 of which were spent in the payments/financial industry. You’re familiar with the merchant landscape, payment network rules and the implementation of international, European and US payment service and financial regulations, AML/CFT and compliance standards.
You’ve worked extensively in your field in a bank, a payment provider or a marketplace. You’re experienced in underwriting checks, reporting, KYC/B, investigations, data analysis, audits, regulatory work, research. Your strengths include decision making, being unafraid to take liability, and being a team player with a proactive approach.
As an Head of Underwriting, you will:
Analyze, evaluate and make underwriting decisions in line with compliance / legal guidelines and recommendations, coordinating with analysts and other risk teams
Define underwriting strategy and recommend underwriting plans and structure that will generate a continued company growth in current and future markets
Lead teams who monitor customers activity and identify inconsistent behavior on a daily basis
Be responsible for underwriting document filings, accuracy of data entries to systems for accounts underwritten
Establish appropriate internal underwriting procedures and criteria to control risk together with our Compliance team
Integrate business-related recommendations into your underwriting process
Work closely with the Risk and Fraud team to decide which merchants we should accept
Keep our policies and operational processes in sync through implementation cycles by updating documentation to reflect our processes and our procedures through our daily routine
Contribute to the development of compliance policies and procedures
Help refine tools and practices to optimize manual reviews

We are:
Payments by Wix - a fast-growing company dealing with all aspects of online payment processing and financial services for Wix users. Essentially, we make it possible for Wix users to get paid on their website. We’re a customer-obsessed group of experts, from all disciplines, with vast knowledge and experience in fintech. Payments by Wix is a high focus company, responsible for processing the income of millions of businesses. In addition, one of our main focuses is our in-house payment gateway, Wix Payments.
Within the group, our underwriting team works to make it easy for Wix users to accept payments online. We use cutting edge technology to ensure that both us and our merchants are compliant with laws and regulations throughout the world.
You are:
A creative Underwriting Specialist with at least 4 years’ experience and 2 years spent in the payments/financial industry. You’re familiar with the merchant landscape, payment network rules and the implementation of International, European and US payment service and financial regulations, in addition to AML/CFT and Compliance standards. You’ve worked extensively in your field and are experienced in compliance checks, reporting, EDD, investigations, data analysis, audits, regulatory work, research.
Your strengths include decision making, being able to take liability, and you’re a team player with a proactive approach. Bonus points if you have practical experience in dispute resolution, card brand cooperation, knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and data analytics.
You’re an analytical person who enjoys investigating and problem-solving. You must possess critical and analytical skills!
As a Senior Underwriting Specialist, you will:
Monitor customer activity and identify inconsistent behavior on a daily basis.
Work closely with the Risk and Fraud team to decide which merchants we should accept and which we should refuse
Provide support and guidance on prospects in regards to our restricted and prohibited business models.
Integrate business-related recommendations into your underwriting process.
Contribute to the development of compliance policies and procedures.
Investigate accounts and transactions to ensure their compliance with existing requirements.
Review and approve prospects of KYC documents to ensure they meet our requirements as well as determine the overall risk of their business model.
Help refine tools and practices to optimize manual reviews.

We are: 
Wix’s Security team - we’re the hands-on bodyguards who keep Wix’s information safe & secure. We protect the integrity of our data, allowing Wix to work well and efficiently. With an in-depth understanding of every aspect of our information security, we team up with business, developers and IT administrators, as well as other teams, to analyze the effectiveness of our security. We also communicate flaws in our systems, recommend solutions and develop tailormade best-practices to keep our company’s - and users’ - data secure.
You are:
An Application Security Expert OR experienced developer who’s passionate about security. You have in-depth knowledge of web application exploitation techniques and software development. You also have a great understanding of web application vulnerabilities, application authentication and authorization protocols, application security methodologies, secret management, PKI and SSL/TLS.
You’re excited by the idea of taking on many responsibilities, can work independently, and you’re flexible. Plus, you’re an open-minded self-learner who likes to stay up-to-date with leading technologies. 
Bonus points if you’re familiar with Node/Java/Scala programming languages, docker containers and kubernetes, AWS and GCP environments, cloud and microservices architectures, hands-on web application PT, Ngnix, AppArmor.
As a Security Expert, you will:
Research, identify, evaluate and come up with the best solutions for security findings within Wix’s production environment.
Work closely with development and system teams on all SDLC levels, performing security design reviews, threat modeling and penetration tests, while acting as a security mentor for developers.
Investigate abnormal activities in production.
Build creative tools and services to detect and solve cross security issues.

We are:
Wix’s Security team - the hands-on bodyguards that keep the company safe and secure. Wix runs on production clusters across multiple data centers and cloud vendors, deploying hundreds of times per day over an ever-evolving ecosystem of more than 1,300 microservices, and handling daily traffic of about 200 million users.
This introduces unique security challenges, from code and secrets safety, through data protection and vulnerability detection, to automatic abuse prevention and monitoring. We're looking for a talented Backend Developer to join our team.
You are:
An awesome, curious, motivated developer with at least 3 years’ experience using server-side technologies in a web environment. You have an in-depth understanding of FP and OOP. You’re familiar with common Web Application Vulnerabilities and are passionate about Web Security. You care about design, experienced with TDD methodology and microservices architecture, take responsibility, and can work independently.
You’re flexible and willing to adjust to context changes. Plus, you’re an open-minded self-learner, trying to keep in touch with what happens around you. You want to play on the team and help it succeed. People enjoy working with you.
Bonus points if you:
Can understand and write multi-threaded code, specifically a web server's request lifecycle.
Understand functional patterns and toolkits.
Have contributed to open-source software.
Understand database systems, relational and otherwise.
Can conduct performance analysis for a system and find its bottlenecks.
Have been a “go-to” person in your previous teams/organizations.
Have a get-things-done approach. 
As a Security Backend Engineer, you will:
Build creative tools and services to detect and solve cross security issues.
Work on cutting-edge technologies.
Improve your skills and learn from top-notch engineers and security researchers.
Participate in threat-models and take part in SDLC.
Tackle tough problems and find creative ways to solve them.
Write TDD and functional code.

We are
Wix’s Information Security - a group of highly motivated security engineers which is a part of the massive R&D group at Wix. Our job is extremely challenging due to huge scales, the agility and the high-end technical diversity at the company.
We’re there at all significant milestones: design, innovation, SDLC, architecture, infra, development of dedicated tools/solutions, visibility, monitoring, risk management and responding.
Our job is to allow the Wix and its users to achieve their goals in the most secure way, and it often sends us to find or create dedicated avangard solutions. We enjoy the ultimate playground in terms of technologies and advanced colleague teams, and we are very proud of it. This is genuine teamwork with an extremely large place for indepence, innovation and creativity to each team member.
You are :
An experienced delivery-oriented team player with 3+ years of experience in tech and project management in cyber security. You always get things done while maintaining a great team spirit. You’re exceptional at organizing methodologies and in problem solving, and you have a deep understanding of web-based products and their security aspects. You have vast experience in implementing security systems at mid-large organisations and you’re able to support a cross-location, multi-cultural team thanks to your excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Hebrew. You are excited by the idea of taking many responsibilities, and can work as an independent, open-minded self-learner who likes to stay up-to-date with leading technologies. You have a great tech oriented approach and you are great in leading security requirements according to GRC methodologies across technical populations (R&D, IT, DevOps).
As a Security expert you will be:
Combine risk management and secure architecture in different environments at Wix
Mapp and analyze  complex environments and create policies and guidelines according to security best practices
Work closely with implementation teams (IT and within security)
Reflect the current security posture and gaps to relevant stakeholders within your domain
Build a relevant work plan to mitigate the risks on your domain while reflecting it to stakeholders
